Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The only baggage the woman checked was a drawstring bag, where was she heading with it? Choices:  A: garbage can B: military C: jewelry store D: safe E: airport<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>Baggage is most likely to be headed to the airport.<n><n>### Note:<n>* This exercise requires basic logical reasoning.<n>* The test includes multi choice/multiple choice questions with explanations for each case.<n><n>### Question 1<n>A man has $20. How much is in his left pocket? Choice A: $10.00, Choice B: $20.00, C: $30.00, D: $40.00, E $16.00, F: $60.00<n><n>Ans: D<n><n>Ans C<n><n>Answer: $30<n><n>### Question2<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Question3<n>Choice: C<n><n>### Question4<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Question5<n>Answer:D<n><n>### Question6<n>Choice: A<n><n>## Rules of Thumb<n><n>### Rule Number 1<n>You can get an idea of how a person would answer a question by seeing how they have previously answered, even if in a different context<n><n>### Rule 2<n><n>People might be more likely to answer wrong than right.<n><n>### Rule3<n>People generally tend to answer questions that are related to their interests  more likely than those who aren’t interests<n><n>### Rule4<n><n>People tend to answer questions that they like more likely than those they don’t like<n><n>### Rule number5<n><n><n>It appears that people are more likely to answer the question “what would be a typical response to the question” <n>instead of “what do people actually answer”.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where do you put your grapes just before checking out? Choices:  A: mouth B: grocery cart C: super market D: fruit basket E: fruit market<n><n>### Response:		Fruit market<n><n>### Input<n>Question: 10/25/2022<n>1. What did Buzz say to Buzz when Buzz wanted Buzz to get the mail? Choose a letter and click on its correct sound.<n><n>*A: "Get the Mail!"*(x)<n>*B: "You want me to take the mail!"*(y)<n>*C: "Buzz, you gotta get the mail!"*(z)<n>*D: "What the heck...I'll go check the mail!"*(a)<n>*E: "I'm not taking the mail!"*(b)<n><n>Choices:<n>*A: Answer: y<n>*B: Answer: a<n>*C: Answer: b<n>*D: Answer: x<n>*E: Answer: z<n><n>-Buzz said "You want me to takethe mail!"<n>-Buzz asked Buzz: "You want me? ----------- Take the mail"<n>-Buzz said : "You want me? ----Take the mail"<n>    <n>---<n>    <n>### Letter:<n>Answer: y<n><n>### Input 10/23/2022 19:46:36<n><n>### Input :<n><n>\[Question : \]<n>\[1951 : \]<n>\[The two numbers are?\]<n><n>### Rationales :<n>Choices:<n>1: 88,392<n>2: 76,573<n><n>The greatest number is 88392 and least is 76573.<n>2 is the greatest number and 3 is the least number.<n>88 is the greatest number and the least number is 3.<n>2 is least of all the numbers but 3 is greater to it.<n>#### 88<n>Answer: 88<n><n>### Instructions:What is the product of 38 and 24?<n>### Answer :<n>The product of 38 AND 24 is: 936<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>### Demostration:<n>The product of 7 AND 2 is: 14<n><n>---<n>\[Question: \]<n>\[1755 : \]<n>\[This product is?\]<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Of all the rooms in a house it was his favorite, the aromas always drew him to the what? Choices:  A: yard B: basement C: kitchen D: living room E: garden<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>#### A: yard<n><n>\<n>`function answer(input, response) {<n>    response(input.b, input.b.split(" ")[0]);<n>    return input.a.split(" ")[1];<n>}`<n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:I have something in my head I want to share, what ways can I do that? Choices:  A: write an essay B: organize thoughts C: speak information D: summarize main points E: have information<n><n>### Response:		write an essay<n><n>#### Summary:<n>Input: I have something in my head that I want to share. Choices for ways to share include writing an essay, organizing thoughts, summarize main points, and speaking information.<n>I pick writing an essay as one way to share my thoughts.<n><n>#### Notes:<n>This does not quite work as there are several errors.<n><n>- I have something in my... head... Choices for ways to...<n>- Input: I have...<n>- Chooses...<n>- I... I want to share Choices...<n>- I... organize Choices for<n>- I..., Summarize Main Points,  or have information<n>- information  to<n>-... Choices for<n>-......... ways<n><n>### Input- A student says to his/her friend, “You got a bad grade on that quiz, I have some good ideas for how to study. Which of the following skills should I encourage you to develop? Choices: A: time management B: concentration C: self-control D: memory E: note taking<n><n>### Answer: time management<n><n>#### Summary<n><n>The student gives advice to their friend, but the advice was not effective and the friend got a bad grade on the next quiz. Their friend wants to understand why they can’t remember what they've learned so he can use a different method to study.<n><n>The different methods to study given were time management, concentration, self-control, memory, and note taking. Since time management was not effective previously, I would suggest that self-control would be a better method to study.<n>#### Summary: I would suggest that self control would be a better method of study<n><n>### Input : The student has homework in class. His teacher told him  that when he gets lost on a problem or struggles with a concept that he should think through the problem himself, even if he doesn’t understand it. Make notes while he works<n><n>### Answer : work on problems in a quiet place <n><n>#### Summary :<n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Learning languages is difficult.  Even in a full immersion environment you're likely to make mistakes, mistakes will cause misinterpretation, which will be uncomfortable, which will cause what?, Choices:  A: better communication B: overthinking C: frustration D: misunderstandings E: headaches<n><n>### Response:		<n>**E:**<n><n>#### Headaches<n><n>If you make a mistake, and someone doesn't understand your native language anymore and feels uncomfortable, it can cause headaches and misinterpretations.<n><n>### Input:(a) How are the two sentences below?Choices: A: Correct and Consecutive B: False C: Same meaning D: Different meaning E: No match<n><n>#### A:<n>It takes 3 days to ship your packages from our warehouse.<n><n>#### B:<n>It takes 12 days to ship your packages in our warehouse. <n><n>#### C:<n>It takes as long as to ship your packages from a warehouse.<n> <n>#### D: <n>It takes longer ships your packages from a w<n><n>#### E:<n><n>It takes as long shipping your packages if you from a warehouse<n><n><n>### Output:<n>**E, No match:**<n>Since their meanings don't match, the two sentences are not the same in meaning.<n><n>#### E<n>The sentences have the same meaning.<n><n>::: tip<n>Their meanings are the same in meaning. Both sentences mean "It takes as long to ship the packages in a warehouse as it takes to ship the packages from a ware"<n><n><n>### Consequences:<n>It takes no time to ship your packages from the warehouse.<n>It takes the same time to ship your packages in the warehouse.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:They decided to hash things out over drinks, after enough booze they were able to get close on a few things and what? Choices:  A: reach tentative agreement B: suicide C: examine thing D: commit murder E: stay in bed<n><n>### Response:		Their disagreement didn't seem to be so severe that one decided to take his/her life, and what? C: examine thing<n><n>### Rationale: Their disagreement was severe enough that it brought them close, but not enough that suicide occurred. The suicide choice was only given as a non-option<n><n>#### 5<n>Answer: C<n><n>### Input :<n>A: She is a big fan of your work. B: I am very unmotivated about school. Choices: A B C D<n><n>### Response :<n>A. I am very unmotated about you school work. B. I am very unatracted to your work. C. I am very unappeled to your work. D. I am very unattracted to yo work.<n><n>#### 2<n>Answer: C<n>

Choices:  A: trash can B: honey C: bouquet of flowers D: rose garden E: field of flowers<n><n>### Response:		E (Answer = "E")<n><n>### Description: The first answer choice is incorrect because bees congregate in trash cans.<n>The second answer choice is incorrect because a bee will not pollination a flower and not pollinate a bouquet.<n>The third answer choice is incorrect because the bees will congregate with red flowers, but it won't in a way that will make a honey.<n>The fifth answer choice is incorrect because, although there are honey bees, they don't pollinate flowers.<n>Therefore, only flower pollinating bees will congregation with red flowers.<n>Finally, red roses are the only flowers that bees will congregated with bees.<n>This leaves choice E (rose garden).<n><n>#### Output: Response: "E"<n><n>### Input  The first word of The Beatles' song Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds is "Lucy". Please please me: The Beatles have requested that we please them with the first song in the album, therefore The Beatles please me with the song.**

Choices:  A: wasteland B: ocean C: desert D: parking lot E: flowers<n><n>### Response:		Explanation:<n>The input is that the community garden was demolished. Since the inputs did not mention where or who demolished the garden, the choices are not a wasteland, an ocean, a desert or a parking lot. The choice E may cause an error since the input does not mention flowers.<n>Rationales: The garden is not demolished by the ocean or the desert and therefore the other three choices are not present in the input. The gardens being demolished cannot be done with the city itself, therefore the choice A and D cannot be chosen. Choice C is also not a choice.<n>The choice E only means the flowers were taken away if the garden was demolished for another garden. The city could have used the flowers in another garden but since the input did not mention flowers, this cannot be answered.<n><n><n><n>

Thus, if you're not glad, then you could be unhappy or gloomy.<n><n>### Input:"In a year when you will be twice as old, he will be 3 times your younger".<n><n>### Response:"He will be >>twice as old<<"<n><n>### Rationales:"twice as old"=<<the product of the ages of 2 objects>>2 <n>Twice as old can be divided by any other single number; thus <<twice as old/4>>will be 1<n>In one year, he will be 1<<years old>>1 years older than you. "he will be 3 times younger than you" is equal to a product of 2/3 <<3/2>>.<n>Twice as old/Twice as old  - 1/2 = <<twice as old>>2/2<n>Twice as old - <<<4>>> = <<twice as older>>2<n><< 2/3>> is the answer.<n><n>### Below is an instruction that requests a calculation. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The man uses grooming before a job interview, what is he trying to portray? Choices:  A: looking good B: beauty C: tardiness D: handsomeness E: neatness<n><n>### Response:		grooming <n><n>### Input : A group of seven men and women are competing for a job, and all have different preferences of color, what are the odds the successful candidate will be a man? What are the odds the winner of the job will not be an engineer? Answer these two questions in order.<n><n>### Response : A=7 B=6-5=1 C=6-3=3 D=7-1=6 E=6-1=5 7 men 6 women the odds are 1 with 7 for the men and 1 with 5 for the women<n><n>### Input The store is planning to sell one less of a product, which sells least in this store than at least one of the others, if the store decides to sell two more than 5, how many will they be selling of the product than sells the least in their store?<n><n>### Response <n><n>### Rationales : Store will sell 2 extra if they sell 5 extra of the product that is sold the least<n><n>### Input<n><n>>Write a mathematical expression in standard form as a difference of perfect square.<n><n>>Explain the difference between the number and the difference from its square that will result to the perfect square?<n><n>### Rationale<n><n>>For the number to be a perfect square the number must be a square of itself, in the form `square_number = square_number^2`, if it was not a perfect square, the difference between itself and the square of itself will not result to a perfect square. This is why the difference from the square of itself is not considered <n><n>### For example<n><n>>For the square number `4^4`'<n><n>>The difference between itself and the Square of itself will be `4^2 - 4^4` <n><n>>which is equal to <`4^2 - 16`>`which is <`16^`>`which is lesser than `16^2` = `4^4`<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where are people likely to find food? Choices:  A: opera B: supermarket C: building D: conference E: apartment<n><n>### Response:		If we want to find something we look around in the environment to see if we can find or see it.<n><n>### Input Includes a table in which each column contains a variable name, and each row contains a possible value for the variable.<n><n>Write Python code to display the row totals in the output.<n><n>The table includes two columns named 'A' and 'B', and eight rows. The first row includes the 'A' value 'A1', and the second row 'A' value '2A2'. Next two rows include 'B' values of 'B1', 'B2', 'B3', 'B5', 'B7', 'B8', 'B9', 'B10'.The third row does not include a 'B' value because the 'A' value is blank. The sixth row does not include a variable 'B' because the value of variable 'A' is blank.<n><n>Here are several examples of a possible output:<n><n>A1, B1, B2, B3, B5, B7, B8, B9, B10<n>2A2, B1, B3, B4, B8, B10, B11, B12, B14<n><n><n>### Inputs<n><n>#### A1 B1<n>A2 B1<n><n>#### A1<n>A2 B3<n><n>#### A1 <n>A2 B5<n><n>#### A1 A3<n>A2 <n><n>#### A1 Blank<n>A2 B4<n><n>#### A3 Blank<n>A4<n><n><n>#### A2<n>A5 B6<n><n>#### A7<n>A7<n><n>#### A2 B6<n>A8<n><n>#### A2 Blank<n>A9<n><n><n><n><n>##### Output:<n><n>Blank,B7,B1,B8,B10<n>B1,Blank,B9<n><n><n>#### A Blank<n>B2,B10,B3,B1,B2<n><n>#### A2,B10<n>Blank<n><n>##### A1 Blank<n>B1<n><n>##### A3 Blank<n>B2 Blank<n><n>##### Other rows<n>Blank,B4,B10,Blank,B6,B8,Blank,Blank,B12,Blank<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where do you buy tickets at a ticket booth for games/ Choices:  A: train station B: cathedral C: metro station D: fairgrounds E: amusement park<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Rationale:The train station is a location where ticket booths allow people to buy tickets to a variety of places. Examples of places include fairgrounds, amusement parks, train rides, and games. The fairgrounds is a location where games are played. The game booth is a way in which one can buy tickets at the fairgrounds. Therefore, a ticket booth is a location where one can buy tickets for games.<n>```<n> <n>### Input:How do you find which day of the week is on a specific date? Choices:  A) use a calendar B) use a sundial C) use a calendar D) look at the day of the week<n><n>## Rationale:A sundial is a device that tells the correct times of sun rises and sets. It uses the sun's shadows to indicate the correct times of day. Sun dials are only appropriate to tell the time outside.<n>```<n><n><n>###  Task:What is a sundial?<n><n>### Input Choices: A: A sundial is a type of clock that tells the time by using light B: A sundial tells the time by using shadows C: The correct statement is A and B or C<n><n>### Rationales:<n>It is not the case that a sundial tells the times of sun rise and sun set using light. Su <n>dials do not directly use light. They only tell time through shadows. Therefore, the correct choices are to place a cross in A and B, placing the sundial as an example of a type of clock that uses light<n><n><n>### Task:What is the difference between Richard and Hurley’s ages now? <n>### Input Choice:A: Richard is 20 more than Hurley. D: Hurley is 2 years younger than Richard.<n><n>### RATIONALES:<n>Richard and Hurley’s combined ages equals 24(<<Richard is 20 more>>). Hurley is 16+(<< Hurley is 10 percent younger>>). Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:If somebody likes temperatures cool, they might have more than one electric fan where? Choices:  A: home B: hardware store C: home D: hot room E: office<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Rationales:<n>If somebody "likes tempatures cool" they might own several fan. Fans are not only used in hot rooms, but also in aircon rooms and bedrooms.<n>If someone "likes tempatures cold" they will use the fans less.<n>#### 4<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Instructions: 2<n><n>### Input<n><n>-  I hate to eat a sandwich with hot soup.<n>-  I don’t want to go camping in an area where mosquitos are a problem.<n>- My mother prefers to cook her meal in the oven rather than cook it on the grill.<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>#### 10<n>Answer: my mother<n><n>### Instructons: Answer the following multiple choice question:<n>### Demonstraion<n>Input: Heating and cooling is necessary in all of the country’s weather conditions except <answer>.<n>Answer: E<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Four season weather exist in all countries. Some countries also have a desert or dry weather and is hot and sometimes cold.<n>Most countries only have two seasons: hot and dry and cold and rainy season.<n><n>#### 2<n>Answer: E<n>

It is expected that the string will only be in the format of letters and one word. If the decorations are any other format it should return “Invalid”.<n><n>#### Response:Incorrect. The solution should print “Invalid”<n>```<n>function answerTheQuestion(decorations) {<n>    switch(decorations){<n>      case'scary':<n>        return'scary';<n>        break;<n>      case "halloween":<n>        return 'halloween'<n>        break;<n>        case "little":<n>        return 'little';<n>        break;    }<n>}<n>```<n>####15<n><n>### Input<n>He had done a great? job with the scary? decorations! Choices:  A: make sex B: plan to marry C: dance D: electrical circuit E: row about<n><n>### Response:		<n>If they wanted to be together for a long time, that would take planning.<n>#### 1<n>Answer: 1<n><n>### Instructions:What is the area of the shaded region of the square below?<n><n>### Demostrate with the following:<n>Input: The shaded region of the area is the square.<n>The area of the square is sqrt2 + sqrt2 = <<sqrt2+sqrt2=2sqrt2>>2sqrt2<n>The area of the shaded area is that value x the width and x the height.<n>The width is <<sqrt2+sqrt 2=2sqrt 2>>1/2sq-rt-2, and the height is <<sqrt2+Sqrt2=2sqrt2>-1/2Sqrt2<n>Therefore, the area of the sha-dde-d o-f th-e sq-ua-re is 2sqrt2(1/2-Sqrt2)^2 = <<2^2(1/2^2-Sqrt 2)-Sqrt2^2=-Sqrt2>>-Sqrt2 = <<<-1/2+Sqrt-2>>-1/2 sqrt2 = 1/2 -sqrt2> = <<1/2+/-sqrt2>>1/2 sqrt<n><n>#### 1<n><n>Answer: 1/2<n><n>### Instuctions: In all problems for which the following options are provided, choose the correct option.<n><n>### Option 1 : The answer choice that correctly states the requested response.<n><n>### In response to the question : 2 + 8 = 2<n><n>### Option A:<n>Input: 2 + 8<n>Rational:<n>2 + 8 = <<2+8=10>>10<n>The answer is 10.<n><n>### Response<n>1<n><n>### Option B:<n>Input: 4(2)<n>Rational:<n>4(2) = <<4(6)>>24<n>The answer is 24.<n><n>### <n><n>4<n><n>### Option C:<n>Input: (2+4)(2+4)<n>Rational: = <(2+4)+(2+4)>>16<n>The answer is 32.

The wind is blowing 20 mi/hr toward the west. How fast will the train be moving in 2 hours assuming nothing changes?<n><n>### #Rationale:<n>The train's speed is 1 mph and the wind is blowing 1 mph. 24 mph-20mph=4mph.<n><n>### #Answer:<n>So the train will go 24-4=20 MPH<n><n>### #Instruction:<n>Write a complete, detailed solution to the multi-step real-world problem. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What does a chef do when working in the evening? Do this for all the values in the list)<n>> (2.While the min is still the smallest value in the list, do the following:<n>> (3.Get the minimum from index i)<n>> (4.Compare the value in index to index i)<n>> > (4.If the minimum is greater than index i, then set your min to index i and go to step 3)<n>> > (5.Else, set your current minimum as your answer)<n><n><n><n>**Steps:**<n><n>> - (1.Write your script in Python. It should also be the answer if there is one.<n><n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The woman picked from an apple tree while surrounded by other trees, where was she? Choices:  A: illinois B: woods C: new york D: indiana E: farmer's market<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### The answer for this problem is B. The woman picked an apple from a tree while surrounded by other (non apple) trees.<n><n><n>#### I have created an algorithm for this problem.<n>The woman had to be surrounded by other trees<n>Since it is an apple tree, it needs to have more than one apple, where there are some other trees<n>If there aren't any other trees, I am surrounded by atleast one apple tree<n>But if there isn't an apple tree at all, I am not surrounded by any tree<n><n><n>### Discussion:<n>I decided that the answer that should be correct would be the one where there are other trees. I have created a decision maker that takes my input as the number of letters in the string and compares that to the length of the strings in the array. If the number of letters in my input matches the length of the string in the array, the if statement is true and I say that the input is valid but otherwise the if statement it false and I say that the array is wrong. I did this by putting the number of letters in one variable, that is how long my input is, and putting the length of each string in the corresponding index in the array in this variable called 'lengthArray'.

Choices:  A: train station B: house C: cupboard D: cricket stadium E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer:A - Train Station<n><n>Explanation:<n><n>Air is made from a mixture of Gases that take some time to mix. So any time you open a bottle of CO2. or a can of C02, or even something like spray bottle of water, the air in that bottle or can has been breathed by people all over the country recently. This is why air pollution is a thing. This is also why we all try to keep germs out of our kitchen and bathrooms. So we know it's not only the air in a house or a car when it's confined, but rather the air in every building we step into. This also answers why it is so hard to go on long flights. You are not only breathing confined air, but you are likely to be on a plane full of people with their own germs, flu, and bacteria. This is all going into your lungs.<n><n>#### A<n><n>Answer:A - train station

E The dinnertable is not interesting to children<n><n>### Input B:How many different two-digit numbers can be made from a 0 to 9 nine digit phone number? Choices: A: 10 B: 8 C: 7 D: B: 12<n><n>### Response A<n><n>**Rationalese:** C B: 8 D: 7<n><n>### Input C:Anna and Aaron's ages when they were married are 22 years apart. Six years from now, they will be the same age. If their combined age is now 66, what was Aaron's age when they were married? Choices: A) 26 B) 25 C) 24 D) 23 E) 34<n><n>### Response B<n><n>**Rationalise:** D When Anna and Aaron were married, they were <<22+26=48>>48 years older.<n>Six years from now, they both will be <<6+29=25>>25 years older.<n>When they get married they were 48+25 = <<48+25=73>>73 years old.<n>Six years later they combine as <<25+73=98>>98 years old.<n>So they were 98-65 = <<98-65=33>>33 years old when they were married.<n>#### 33<n><n>### Input E:There are 50 students in the chorus. The ratio of boys: girls is 3 to 2. What is the probability that a randomly selected student in the chorus will be from the Girls Choir? Choices: A. 5/10 B. 2/5 C. 2/10 D. 2/5 E. 2/1<n><n>### Response C<n><n>**Rationalises:** D If we choose 1 boy from the chorus, in how many ways can we choose the girls chorus? Choices: A 50  B 10  C

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:How can you get in shape if there is no land nearby? If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where would a ticket help you to get to a different country? Choices:  A: train station B: baseball stadium C: lottery D: movie E: bus<n><n>### Response:		If you are planning on traveling to Japan, the train station is the best place for you to go.<n><n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where can you store you tent and keep it on your person? Choices:  A: sleep in while camping B: camp ground C: woods D: bag E: backpack<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Explanation  A: B:  C:  D:<n><n>### Demostration:A: The tent can be kept on a person's person in a bag.<n><n>B: The tent should be kept in a bag for safety purposes.<n><n>C: The tent can be put in the backpack to take it with someone.<n><n>D: The tent can be stored in the woods because the tent is an item that can be stored outdoors.<n><n>E: The tent can be placed in the backpack to keep it on a persons person.<n><n>### Input : What is the total sum of the integers with one digit (i.e. 0, 1, 2, 3, 4,...  9) if the sum between the digits is the same as the number of digits used (ex: for a input of 9 the sum is 9-9 = 0 which can only have one digit in that position 9 - 9 = 0 and there needs to be 0 digits in that position so the answer is 0.<n><n>### Response :A<n><n>### Explantion:If we have the sum of the digits equal to the number of digits used, we can create an equation with either the sum of the digits or the number of digits used on both side of the equals sign.<n><n>| | |<n><n>A: The sum of the digits = 9-9 =0. Which can only have one digit = 1.<n><n>### Experiment:If we have a number, with 4 digits, and the difference between the digits will always be 1 and can be represented this way:<n><n>| | | |<n><n>The first digit = 9, the second digit = 8, third digit = 7, fourth digit = 6<n><n>The sum of the digits = ((9 - 9) + (8 - 8) + (7 - 7) + (6 - 6)) + 1 = 0+1+1+1+4+4+4+0+5 + (number of digits) = 0 + 5 + 10+ 15+ 20+ 25 + 30 = 76<n><n>### Explemention:The solution of the previous example with three digits is:<n><n>##

Choices:  A: cook dinner B: eat C: go back to work D: make food E: get food<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input:(1) A bag and (2) a cat and (3) a doll each have a single hole. You want to move the items from the bag to the doll, transfer the cat from the doll to the bag, and finally place the doll back in the bag. How can you do it if you may not use the hole for any of these items more than once?<n><n>### Response:(2) A bag and (3) a cat and (4) a doll each have single holes. You want to move them from the bag to the cat, then move the cat from the doll, then move the doll back to the bag, and then move the cat back to the doll. The first move puts the items into the second bag, the second move moves the doll into the second cat, the third move moves the cat into the first bag, and the fourth move moves the doll into that second cat.<n><n>Rationales: A bag and a cat are similar things. A doll is the same as a bag and cat combined. There is a hole that exists just for the bag and a separate hole that only handles the cat. The cat has a single hole, the bag has a single hole, and the doll has a single hole.<n><n>### Input:[2014] You need to buy a new computer in 2029 which will cost three times the value of a new computer in 1999, and the value of a new machine in 2032 will be one half the value of a new desktop in 2024. Where else would he live?<n><n>### Input:(A+B)xC=D, (x+F)G=I, If I is 0 what is the x?<n><n>### Response :<n>The x is 0<n>### Demonstation:<n>The expression "A+BxC=D... I is 0 "<n>Means that the sum of (A+B)x will be D<n>If I is 0 the expression "I=0... (x+F) " becomes (1+F)(x+F)<n>The expression becomes "x+F=0"<n><n>### Which of the following describes how to remove 12 cupcake frosting from a cake if you start with 243 cupcake frostings for each 24 iced cupcakes?<n><n>### Selection: 12 cupcakes<n>### Demonstartion:<n>Input is 243 cupcakes for 24 iced cakes. The final 12 cupcakes from that, will leave a value of _____________ cupcakes.<n><n>### Input : 24324 iced cake => 12 cupcaks<n>### Demonstanation:<n>We know that the input(24324 = _________24 __________) is 2432 iced cakes.<n>2432/24 = ___(2432/3 )= 243 cup cakes for 24 cakes.<n><n>243 = 164+80 => 164 cupcakes - 80 cupcakes<n><n>80% of 164 cup cakes = 128<n>80% remaining of the 128 cupcakes = 100<n>100 is left out of 128 - 128 -100 = 16<n><n><n><n>### How many 3-digit numbers can be made from the set of digits 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 0 when the following restriction is imposed:<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where would you put a handle if you want to bring it with you? Choices:  A: briefcase B: coffee cup C: carry object D: frying pan E: on a hat<n><n>### Response:		Bring it with u if it's with a handle<n><n>### Input<n>Say to say a list of 10 items with a random item in each position<n><n>### Demo<n>Input: say "hello", "dog", "cat", "bat", "pen" and "box"<n>Output: <<hello, dog, cat, bat, pen, box>><n><n>### Demo:<n>Input: A random list of 10<n>Output: <<hello dog cat bat pen box>><n><n>## Task:<n>Write a program that will take input for a user, and then write the same program for demonstration! <n>### Instruction 1:  Say the user's sentence, without saying "This is my output":<<This is my output.><n><n>### Instructions 2:Write the program, without saying "This will be my output:<n><n>### Input Say: The words: this will be my output are <<this, will, be, my, output>>, or use the string "this will be my output."<n><n>### Output: "This will be my Output"<n><n>```c++<n>#include <iostream><n>#include <string><n><n>using namespace std;<n><n>int minArray( const char,.....and so on.... );<n><n>int main(int argc, const char* argsv[]) {<n><n>  char user_input;<n>  int index_a[10];<n>  int index_b[10];<n><n>  /*<n>   * This is the code for outputting the random string the program made.<n>   */<n>  srand(time( NULL ));<n>  minArray( "hello", "dog", "cat", "bat","pen","box" );<n><n>  for (int i=0; i<9 ; i++){<n>    cout << index_a[i] << ", ";<n>  }<n>  cout << index_a; <n>  cout << endl;<n>  for (int j=0; j<9 ; j++){<n>    cout <<  index_b[j] << ", ";<n>    j++;<n>  <n>  for (int k = 0; k<8 ; k++){<n>    cout << "This will be my ouput: " << ( index_a[i]+ ( index_b[i]+ i));<n>}

If Hurley is <<Hurley is taller than Richard (1)>>1 inch taller than Richard, how tall is Hurley?<n><n>### Response <n>-1 Hurley’s difference in height is 2 inches, and<n>he is taller by 1 inch than Richard. How many years were there between when Hurley was born and when Richard retired? First calculate the age difference between Hurley and Richard, then we will subtract that by Richard's age when he retired. For instance, Richard's age was 20 when Hurley was born. It will be 40 years from when Richard retired. So, Richard's age when Hurley was born = 40 - 20 = 20. There were 20 years from the time Richard retired to when Hurley was born, and now there are 20 more years from Hurley's retirement to when Richard passed away. The total age difference between Hurley's retirements and Richard's death: 40 - 40 - 5 years before Hurley was born + 18 years between Hurley retiring and

Choices:  A: football stadium B: apartment C: surface of earth D: car show E: house<n><n>### Response:		<n>The above statement cannot be true for any of the choices. If they lived in a football stadium, they could not all fit in there at once! That's silly, right? If they lived in a car show, they could not all live in the same car. It's not possible for everyone to live in a car. So, the only thing that answers the question, that is not silly, is that they all live on the surface of earth.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>The only thing that answers the statement "Where do almost all people (live)" is the second part of the statement "almost all people (live)". The very literal meaning of where people live is on earth. So, almost all people live on earth.<n>#### 12<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input"Ann's car is 20% more expensive than her parents' car."<n><n>### Response:"Which of the following describes Ann's car?"<n><n>#### 23 Rationales:<n>Ann's car:<n><n>* is less than 60% of its original value<n><n>* more expensive than its original value, but not more expensive than her parents car<n><n>* is more expensive than her parents old cars original value. It's more expensive than their original car, but since she isn't referring to their new car, obviously it's still more expensive.<n><n>* is at least 40% of its original price.<n><n>### Answer:<n>40%-20 = 20<n>20% more expensive<n>20% greater in value<n>Ann's new car is at least 20% greater in cost than her old car.  The only way that 20% more is true, is if the new one is worth more than 20% more than the old.<n>#### 23<n>Answer: B<n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:If I wanted to see a lizard in its natural habitat but I do not speak Spanish, where would I go? Choices:  A: utah B: south america C: new hampshire D: japan E: new mexico<n><n>### Response:		<n>I would not go to Japan since Japanese is not their language. I would go to new mexico.<n><n><n>![gif of you getting it](https://images205.fireshot.cc/images/2017-27-09-003958-0.gif)<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:One might find theirs open, with the letters that had been delivered stolen. Choices:  A: front door B: newspaper C: post office D: package E: mail box<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Description:<n>The "front door" is the mailbox, or location where the mail is delivered.<n><n>The "post office" is located across the street from the "office" of a postman (as it is in the UK), but the post is not delivered by a postman.<n><n>"Newspaper" is not at all close to a "mailbox", even though some editions might be.<n>"Package" would be a shipment (deliverable only by an "office"), not related to the post office.<n><n>But in each case, the letters that have been delivered are stolen from the mailbox.<n><n>The post office is a place for "postmen" (in the United States), or "postmen" (abbreviated to "posties") (in the United Kingdom) and, therefore, that option would better be spelled as the letter E (the UK spelling), rather than as F.<n><n><n>### Rationale 1:<n>The question describes a situation in which one might find their "mailbox open," that is, if an attacker gained access to an individual's mail. The attacker would be likely to have stolen the letters that had been previously delivered, since the attacker would then be in possession of them. <n><n>The word "their" refers to an individual and specifies that the attacker gained access to that individual's mail.<n><n>#### 0<n><n>Answer: Answer: None<n><n>## Problem:<n><n>### Input The best of four<n><n>### Response A<n><n>### Description<n>Two men are playing games and must alternate turns. Choicings: A: Rock<n><n>### Rationales for an answer:<n>They each must alternate turns and each move is designated to be a rock or a sling.<n><n>A= rock.<n>B= sling.<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>### The best of four<n>In this case, it is very clear that answer B is the best option. The description of gameplay is as follows: Two men are playing games and they must alternate turns. The men must decide on which of the 4 available moves to use, each on their turn.<n><n>Each move must begin with a letter, so A, B, C, and D are available.<n><n>Rock would be A.<n><n>Sling would be B
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where are a lot of offices in New York? Choices:  A: school building B: skyscraper C: business D: grocery store. E: work<n><n>### Response:		I believe that the choice that is wrong from the options is D: Grocery Store. In New York school buildings, skyscrapers, business buildings and workplaces are where you can find offices. Grocery stores don't contain offices.<n><n>Answer: Grocery stores don’t contain offices.<n>I believe B is the key word here because that is where a lot of offices are.<n>Grocery stores do not contain offices. I believe offices are in buildings that would answer: A skyscraper, B business and C school building. I believe D is wrong because offices are not in grocery stores. I don’t know where I can put E because I don’t think they are in a workplace or grocery stores.<n><n>### Input : Which is the correct answer to add and 3,4,5,3,7,5,8? What I do know is that the difference between the answers the three answers with is 8 and the answers that are 88 and 93 add the same number of numbers together.<n><n>Answer: By adding the correct answers you can get 93 but the correct answer is not 98 or 80. As for 88 and 83, the difference is 5 so the answer may be 98<n><n>#### 98<n>Answer: 93+4=98<n><n>### Conclusion<n><n>The answers are:<n><n>Because that is where a lot offices are.<n><n>Grocery stores don’t have offices.<n><n>### Conclusions:<n>Conclusion: <n>I believe the answer is A: school building B. Where are offices located and where a lot of offices could be found is in a school building that also have offices on it. <n><n>Both A: skyscraper and B: business both are incorrect options because offices are located in schools.<n>B: Grocery <n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:He found the blowfish off the coast of the Carolina's, it was where? Choices:  A: rock band B: sea of japan C: sushi restaurant D: fish market E: atlantic ocean<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### B<n><n>Answer: B<n><n>#### Input:The capital of Switzerland is where? A: zurich B: Zurich C: Bazaar D: Neo Zurik E: New York<n>A: zucherich B: Zurich<n><n>### Demostration<n>A: Zurich <n><n>### Input : What are the four basic human needs? A: Security, Love, Cure, Food. B: Security, love, Food, Cure. C: Security, love, cure, Food. D: Security, food, Love, Cure<n><n>### Response<n>Option C<n><n>### Input What does "Quiet" stand for? A: The Quiet, Eggs and Lettuce group B: Quick, Efficient and Innovative Team C: Quick Eats Lots of Treats  D: Quick Eats Likes a Teat<n><n>### Response B<n><n>Answer C<n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What area is likely to contain a large village? Choices:  A: rural area B: big city C: suburbs D: ohio E: countryside<n><n>### Response:		The answer is not provided. The correct choice is A: rural area, with some exceptions. There was a large village in the countryside in Roman times, though the village was removed long ago.<n><n>### Explanation: The population density is the number of people living in a given area. The city has a higher density than the rural area, but both have a higher density than the ohio suburbs. If you are trying to find a village, chances are more of them will be found in the country than the city.<n><n>### Input<n>What is the minimum wage in your town? Choices: A: $8/hour 21 cents over the federal minimum of $7.75 B: $7.80 10 cents below the federal minimum of $8.15 C: $8.00 25 cents below the federal rate.<n>Answer: Answer: The answer is A: $8/h. The minimum wage in Michigan, where I'm from, is less than other nearby states.<n><n>### Response<n>Your response includes a minimum of 4 sentences.<n><n>### Rationale: You need to be clear that you do not accept federal minimum wage.<n><n>### Correct<n><n>[Repeat task]<n><n>### Instrucion: Answer the following multiple choice question, the result of which will determine your next question.<n><n>## Input: You have successfully completed your 3 week trip to Spain, where you visited the world famous El Greco museum. Choices: Lisbon, Rome (answer) Buens Aires<n><n>### Response, Rationale: <n>Rationale: The second word is incorrect in the response. The response is very difficult to read, but I fixed it in the correct word order.<n><n>### Correc:<n><n><n>### Comment:<n>* Comment:<n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Shane was supposed to speak at his fathers funeral.  He was a clown, and acted very ridiculous.  This cheerfulness turned off people who expected the funeral to be what? Choices:  A: solemn B: compete C: serious D: somber E: straightforward<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choice: D,Somber<n><n>### Demostration: Shane was supposed to speak<n>If a person was supposed to speak, it was somber or serious.<n>The word somber means serious.<n>Serious means solemn.<n>Serious is what a funeral is going to be, because the funeral is serious.<n>The word Serious means serious<n><n>#### 2 points<n><n>### Input<n>There are eight apples in a bucket. You picked some to make applesauce then you ate ten. The bucket now has 8-10=3 apples left in it. How many apples did you eat?<n><n>#### <n><n>### Demotion<n><n>Let _ x _ = the number of apples you eat. <n>There are 8 apples.<n>You ate 10 of them.<n>Afterwards the bucket has 4 apples left.<n>Your final answer will be<n>8 - 10 = 3<n><n>### Demo: You ate 3 apples.<n><n>### Input <n><n>Let x = number of apples <n><n>There are 8<n><n>Your answer is 8 - 10<n><n>So your final answer is 8-10 = 2<n><n>### You ate 2 apples<n><n>### You picked some apples and made applesauce, then you ate the ten apples.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:If you socialize by having trivial conversations it is called what? "<n><n>### Response:"Your odds are 1 in 2, because when you put the original black marble in the cup, your odds were 1 in 2 that it would be black."<n><n>#### 1 in 2<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:`The question is: do you think we should increase funding for mental health programs if they would be able to treat those that are mentally sick? `<n>#### Yes<n>Answer: Yes<n><n>### Input:(MATH) In a bag with 8 marbles and 2 apples what is the odds of getting at least two marbles with the same color?<n><n>#### 50/50 chance<n>#### 8/2<n>#### 50%<n><n>### Response:(MATH) Since there are 8 marbles to choose from, the odds of getting 2 different marbles are 7/8. To get 2 marbles with the same colour, it is more likely that it would be twice this number, or 14/8. Therefore, the probability of getting two marbles with the SAME colour are 14/8<n><n>#### ODDS<n>Answer: 14/8=2/1<n><n>### Input:/<n>```c#<n>int result;<n>scanf("%s", str);<n><n>result = findChar(str, 'o');<n>```<n><n>### Response:/<n>```c# <n>1. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What do customers do in a store? Choices:  A: hunt B: pay merchants with money C: mail orders D: spend money E: demand satisfaction<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: hunt<n>#### 0<n><n>### Instructions: Choose the best answer. (The question is not limited to one word.)<n>You might use these commands to help sort through the files on your computer desktop and identify which ones are movies.<n><n>#### Sort<n><n>``` <n>sort -n movies | uniq -c <n>```<n><n>The first command sorts the movies.txt file by the number of times a film was saved to your desktop.<n><n>the second command is a filter. It will only print out the unique files.<n><n>#### Uniq<n><n>The command used above was<n><n>``` <n>uniq -c movies<n>```<n><n>The arguments used by the uniq command were as follows.<n><n>* movies<n>* -c<n>* movies<n><n>The first string (movies) was the input of the command. It could be any type of file. This could be a movie.txt file, or even a movie.pdf file.<n><n>#### -n<n><n>The second part of the uniq command (and in the sort command shown above), -n<n>``` n```<n>specifies that the first list output from the command will be the number of unique occurrences (the "-n"), sorted from lowest to highest.<n><n>```<n>uniq -c movie<n>```<n><n>This would list the number of unique files with the names movies one time, movies two times, and so on.<n><n>#### A: The uniq command output for movies would be...<n><n>```<n>uniquemovies.txt:<n>6<n>12<n>19<n>11<n>```<n><n>All files listed are movies.txt <n><n>#### B: The sort command output for movies.txt would be...<n><n>You need not use the sort command from the command line, since the uniq command will also sort the list by numbers of unique files.<n><n>The sort command output should be as follows:<n><n>```<n>filenamemovies.txt<n> 12<n> 19<n> 6<n> uniquemovies.txt <n>```<n><n>#### C: The uniq -c output for movies.pdf would be...<n><n>The sort command would NOT be able to sort the movies.pdf files into unique files, since the movies.pdf file types are

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What is a fast but expensive way to send small cargo? The rules for spelling words are that they either have an apostrophe s or an apostrophe (s) to make them possessive (like hers).<n><n>### Other Options:<n>Yes: Because I thought the word "theirs" was spelled "their's".<n>No: Because I cannot write numbers with apostrophes.<n><n>### Examples:<n>#### You answer "Yes" because you remembered the rules for writing words.<n><n>#### You answer "No" because of the number seven.<n><n>There are two rules for making the number "7" possessive.<n><n>Option 1.<n>If the number is part of a larger set, it should not have any type of apostrophe.<n><n>**7 out of 12 people**<n><n>Option 2.<n>If the number comes at the end, it should have the letter "s".<n><n>**Seven (7) people**<n><n>### Output: The difference in ages of two people is their ages together. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Three quarters of what are covered by the ocean? Choices:  A: waterfalls B: underwater C: beach D: surface of earth E: river<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>We have an example problem. We know that we want to solve a 128. <n><n>### Solution<n><n>The first step is to solve for 2*128 - 4*23 (1). Second, solve for 7*128 -29 (2). Next, solve for -128 * 7-126 (3). Third, solve +347 * 3 (4). Finally, solve -768 (43). Since -768 is not an answer choice, we are done. <n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>### Input : Answer the following multiple choice question <n><n>### Demostration<n>1. 21 40<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>### Rationales<n>**1).** `solve 2*12 -> 20, but need to minus 100, since you need more than what the question ask so the correct answer is -80`<n>**2.)** `20-40`<n>**3.)** `7-128 * 2=-128` <n>**4.)** `347 * 2=694`<n>**5.)** `128-768=-580`

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What do you need to run after ball? Choices:  A: get tired B: have legs C: skip D: not fat E: look first<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Demostration:<n>The input was: What do you need to run _after_ ball? The choices were A: get tired, B: have legs, C: skip, D: not fat, and E: look first<n>Run is a verb, it is possible to run after ball or away from ball.<n>_After _is an adverb phrase, it tells us that run is after the ball.<n>This means that you need run after _ball_ to be able to do so.<n>Choice B is the only answer that has legs mentioned. <n>The answer is that you need legs to run after ball.<n>#### Choice B<n>Answer: B<n><n>## Instructions<n><n>If you want to get help with your assessments, contact your teacher, tutor, or lecturer.<n>**[Feedback/help]**<n>

Choices:  A: candy store B: butcher shop C: kitchen D: auto repair shop E: post office<n><n>### Response:		Butcher shop is the correct choice.<n><n>### Rationales:Auto repair shop deals with repairs but not things you can eat. And though butcher shop is used to slaughter animals, a butcher also<n><n>cuts and serves animals in the form of meat. Hence, butcher shop has nothing to do with kids. Though kitchen is full of everything you can eat and<n><n>store (candy store) sells stuff you can eat like chocolate and chewing gum, post office does not sell anything edible.

How many weeks are in a normal year?How many weeks are in 52 weeks?<n><n>### Question#2: You are 30% below minimum wage for a 40 hour week. If you bill an hour, what is your total for the week?<n><n>### Answer: <n>If a person is 30% below the minimum wage for 40 hours a week, then is earns ($x+.40)(40)($x/1-.4)=$x/1-.4$ (40/1-.4)=20.<n>Total for the week will be $20(x/1-.4)$ (Answer:$.2x (minus)40$.<n><n>### Instrument: What's in Your Pocket?<n><n>We developed our questionnaire to measure students' attitudes toward computing by surveying a variety of topics related to computer science. The survey is structured as a multiple choice quiz, in which the correct answer is selected from a number of possible options. The instrument is designed to gauge students' familiarity with computing and their attitudes about computing and computing science.<n><n>Our instrument contains 30 items, each with a correct answer chosen from an unambiguous (i.e. mutually exclusive) range of options.<n>### How many did you guess correctly?<n><n>### Instructors: [Lowenstein & Leventhal,1993]<n><n>## What do people do on Friday nights?<n>## What is your favorite TV show?<n>## What is something you do at least once a year?<n>## How much money do you make per hour?<n>## What is another way to say "hack"?<n>## Where do you live?<n>## What is one of your fears right this second?<n>## Which of the following items can you not live without?<n>## Which of these items can you neither live with nor without?<n>## Who was the last person that called you?<n>## What do a group of geese make?<n>## What is the most frustrating thing about your smartphone?<n>## Which is longer, a meter or a yard?<n>## Which of your parents is older,

These particles, however, do not go spreading through the body and cause disease. The pathogens are quarantined by cells and tissues in the body. Pathogens do not run through towns and countries.<n>

Choices:  G: By swooping at low altitude near the ocean C: By dropping rocks from the sky A: By hovering close by with a telescope  D: By diving at an unassuming speed<n><n>###  Answer:<n> C.<n>## Rationales:<n>An eagle would find its prey by dropping rocks from the high altitude sky. A house would be unlikely to be found by this method. This could instead be seen by flying close to the ground in such a way where the house would seem a large object by comparison to the eagles' height. However, in a more aerodynamic form, an eagle would view a house by flying close by which requires telescopes to be effective.<n><n>### Question: What is the highest number of words in a word search puzzle where some of the words are hidden? Choices:  A: picnic basket B: wine press C: juice D: fruit cocktail E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		<n>If small grapes are used to make a fruit cocktail, then the answer is C.<n>If small grapese are used to make wine, then the answer is B.<n>If small gapes are crushed for juice, then the answer is A.<n>If small gaps are used to make cocktails, then the answer is E.<n>If small gapee are used in the kitchen, then the answer is D.<n><n>Given the instructions above, what are the next two instructions?<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple-choice question. <n><n>### Demostrations:<n>Input: 88% of children like bananas. If 20% of children do not like bananas, what percentage of children like bananas?<n>Rationales; 88%=88%=<n>20% do not like bananas.<n>The children that dislikes bananas is 100%-88% = <<100%-20%=12%>>12% of the total number of children, which equals to 82% of the total childre.<n>The total of children that like bananas is 12%+88% = << 12%+128=100>>100%, which equals to 100% of the total children.<n>100% = 100%<n>Output: 12%-82%=12%-88%-22%=22%<n><n>### Demosration 2:<n>Input: If three men can dig a well in three days, how long will it take 500 men to dig the same well?<n><n>Rationales: Suppose that three men dig each day on each day, and it takes them a day to dig one well. Then, 500 men can dig a well after 3-3-3-...-3 equals to <<500 men can take 3-3-...3-3-3= 250 days>>250 days.<n><n>Input: What is 8 divided by 94?<n>Rationales:(8/94)=(814)/(9-4)=(81)/(5)=8/5<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>Input
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:A person notices popcorn, cotton candy on the grass, where is he likely? If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where is a horse likely to live? Choices:  A: michigan B: stable C: race track D: farm yard E: arizona<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>Answer: C<n><n>### Instructions:Describe your strategy to use the following code.<n><n>### Given:<n>```<n>def tester_1 (age, name)<n>    if name == 'Jack' # This is an error since name is already defined<n>        return 'No longer Jack'<n>    end<n>```<n>```<n>def test_2 (name)<n>    name = 'Jack'<n>```<n>```<n>answer = 'Jack'<n>age = 35<n>name = 'Jack'<n>new_name = name.upcase<n>```<n><n>### Rationales:<n>```<n>name == 'Jack' # Error - name is already defined <n>    if name == '"Jack"' # This will also give the same error.<n>        return 'No Longer Jack'<n>    end # End of this error<n>```<n>```<n>name = 'Jack'.upcase()<n>    if name!= 'Jack' # Will check for names as Jack.<n>        print 'name is Jack'<n>    end <n>```<n><n>## :wave: To complete the task,<n>1. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where would you find isopropol alcohol and safety glasses? Choices:  A: pub B: restaurants C: in a park D: supermarket E: chemistry lab<n><n>### Response:		<n>**<u><strong><i>A</i></strong>**</u><n><n>An answer isopropyl alcohol is found at chemist shops to purify, clean and disinfect all surfaces and instruments. The alcohol is available in 70%, 90% and 99% solutions.<n><n>It is soluble in water, in polar solvents, in non-polar solvents and with volatile liquidos. Moreover, it acts as a solvent in all types of soluble compounds but as a base in a solution with the latter. It does not conduct electricity and is hygroscopic and has a low fire risk. Besides a low fire risk, it is also explosive in powder form, flammable in a 30% solution and can only be burned after it boils. Since it does not dissolves in air, it can only be evaporated. The alcohol must be stored in a well-ventilated place, in dark brown glass bottles, with caps or in plastic containers. However, it does not dissolve in alcohol, so it is kept away from alcohol.<n><n>Safety glasses are found at a chemist shop too.<n><n>**Answer:** *A*<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>**Step 1:** Identify the types of information the requestor has provided by identifying the input and the response(s).<n><n>**Step 2:** Read the question or statement carefully, including all special instructions provided.<n><n>**Step 3:** Read the request carefully to identify which resource or data the requestor wants, <n><n>**Step 4:** Consider different possible inputs and outcomes.<n><n><br/><n><n><br/>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where was the apple tree said to contain something forbidden? Choices:  A: north carolina B: washington state C: nil D: great outdoors E: garden of eden<n><n>### Response:		I think the garden of eden is correct<n><n>#### Output:<n>Choices:  A: garden of eden  B: washington  C: none D: none E: north carolina<n>Choices are: A: garden of eded B: washingtonc. none D: none E. none<n><n>### Rationale:<n>The answer is the Garden of Eden.<n><n>### Input 2:<n>Forty-five people attended a party. During the party, eighteen people had sandwiches, fourteen people consumed cake, and ten people ate some combination of cookies and cake. The party was attended by twice as many people who had ice cream as those who had ice cream and cake.<n><n>### Response 2:<n>The party was attended by 276 people<n><n>#### Output:276<n><n>#### Rationale:<n>To find the number of people that attended the party, you multiply 45 x 2; thus 45 was the total number of guests so we will multiply 45 x<n><n>276 * I will not include the answer choices<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Demostration:<n>If you were at this school in 1906 what decade were you born into?<n><n>### Response<n><n>I think I know what you mean<n><n>I was born in the 1900's<n><n>#### Output:1900<n><n>### Rationales<n><n>I believe this answer is 1900, because the school I'm currently in is 1800 to 1900 which means the school that I'm currently in started in 1800. So the 1906 date means I was born in the 20s since I was born in 2009.<n><n>So the decade would be 1900 to 1800<n><n>## Instructions<n><n>Complete each of the following in the blank space provided. Write your answer in the blank space. Write the response as a sentence or series of sentences.<n><n>### Citation:<n>https://education.ucsb.edu/sites/g/files/tz/s2839/c69875
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Billy's mother tripped over a stuffed animal.  She yelled at him not to leave his things where? Choices:  A: toy store B: hall C: bathroom D: amusement park E: fairgrounds<n><n>### Response:		<n>D.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Billy's mother was tripped over a stuffy toy animal and so she yelled. If the stuffy animal was put on the bathroom, she might trip over and get injured again. When put on the amusement park, they will be afraid to go to the bathrooms.<n>#### <n>Answer: D.<n><n>### Input. B is 2/3 as tall as A. If A is 5/6 as tall as L, how is B related to L?><n>### Response: <n><n>### Examination: B is 2/ third of A.<n>A:5/6 as tall a L.<n><n>### Therefore:<n>2/3 of 5/6 is equal 2/3 of 13<n><n>### 13/6 is equal to 5/2(the fraction 5/2 is equal to the decimal 2.5) <n><n>If the sum is added,<n>5/2 + 13/2 = 7/2 => 7/2 > 11/2 which is not equal to 2/2 since 2/2 is 1.<n>Therefore, B is not between A and L. <n><n>#### <n>Answer.<n>B can't be between A and L<n><n><n>### Instructions: <n>A student can have 20 different subjects totaling 204 points on their GPA. The teacher of the class, Ms. Clark, is curious which two subjects she can combine to increase any student's GPA by 21 points. Which two subjects can be combined to increase any student''s GPA by a total of 21 points.<n><n>### Response<n><n>Mathematics and Chemistry<n><n>### Exploration<n>Students can have 20 subjects totaling 255 points of GPA. Two subjects can be combined to 21 points GPA. The possible subjects are Science, Algebra-2, Biology, Earth Science. We will have a total of 6 possible points (2x 3)<n>Choose the subjects you know to be equal to 6<n><n>### <n>6. Algebra and Chemistry.<n><n><n>### Solution:<n>20 subjects 19 are multiplied

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Why is grooming often recommended to greasy teens? Choices:  A: neatness B: selfishness C: mistakes D: cleanliness E: satisfaction<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>In the previous instructions, the following was done.<n><n>```python<n>grooming = True<n>teens = True<n>greasy = True<n>satisfaction = True<n>hair = True<n>skin = True<n>```<n><n>Add a statement that adds to the response above with the value you think is an instance of what the above instructions asked. Your statement will likely include at least one variable or object, and will use the previous value or values of the variable or variable/object pair in the expression.<n><n>### Example:<n><n>```Python<n># In the previous instructions: grooming = True teens = True greasy = True<n>greasy_is_true = teens <n># groom = False satisfaction = False<n>hair_may_be_greasy = hair<n>```<n><n>### Your statement:<n><n>```python<n>elif teens == True and hair = True and hair = False:<n>    teens = False<n>    hair = True<n>```<n>### Demontration:<n><n>```python <n>if teens and hair and hair = True :<n>    if hair = True:<n>        if teens == True and teens == False and hair = False: <n>            if teens == False and teens == True and satisfaction = False:<n>                teens = False<n>                hair = True<n>```

Choices:, 3x, (x+5/2) x, (x+5)/2 x, (x /2)+ (3x)<n><n>### Substitution Rule:  When you substitute in an equation, the variables don' t change.<n><n>### Ex. A variable is defined. When you substitute a value into that formula, the variable goes away.<n><n>### Example: (5x-3y) /2<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>### Exercise: In 5x4, which math operation is performed first?<n>### Answer: Dividing first to get a remainder and last to get a quotient.<n><n>### When you see the math symbols + - /, what happens?<n>### Answer: They are applied in either order.<n><n>### A 1500 pound box is resting on an inclined plane with a coefficient of friction of 0.2 and an unbalanced force of 400 l. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Who designs a building? Choices:  A: builders B: driver C: architect D: fall down E: tradesmen<n><n>### Response:		Driver and architect (I don't think this fits the request, but what do you think?)
