Among them, the family of the victim did something to him. What was that? Choices:  A: knife wounds B: buy a gun C: bleeding D: jail time E: law suit<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Instructions To complete the request, write a response that appropriately answers the question in that form.<n><n>### Answer the question that follows. Explain your answer.<n><n>#### C) To complete the request,write a response that appropriately answerst the question in that form.\ <n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: Which one of the following statements is not one of the four basic types of logic?  <n>A) A disjunction  B) A conjunction C) A conditional D) An exclusion E) A biconditional<n>### Answer: A<n><n>#### A<n><n>To complete the request,write your answer that appropriately answersthe question in that form.\<n><n>### Input :Which of the following statements contains a biconditional?  <n>A) No man is a hero in his own time. B) A man is free in proportion to the freedom of others. C) If P then R D) A man is free to the exact extent to which he is willing to suffer for his own belief E) A bicondoitional must be a combination of A and B<n><n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input/Demonstration:<n>#### A) No man is a Hero in his own time.<n>No Man means person or human.<n><n>It cannot be a word for a dog, rat, or mouse.<n>No is not a word for a person or human or any other animal. So man cannot mean a Person or human. No Man  means no human being.<n><n><n>His means Him and his own time means in his day.<n>His own day means today in a mans life time.<n>His own time does not make sense at all.<n>So No man is a hero is not a sentence with a subject and a predicate.<n><n>Hero  means person who has done some heroic deed.<n>A Person does not do deeds, but a man is a Person and Hero means a man that does heroic deeds or a hero which is another word but still does not make sense.<n>So there is no sentence in the correct form.<n><n>#### B) A man is FREE in proportion to the FREEDOM OF OTHERS.<n><n>A is a subject noun that takes a prepositional predicate preposition in proportion to in this case that means to the same rate

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where in Southern Europe would you find many canals? Choices:  A: michigan B: new york C: amsterdam D: venice E: bridge<n><n>### Response:		C: Amsterdam.<n><n>### Rationale:You can find many canals in Amsterdam. You can’t find canals in Michigan, New York, Bridge, or Venice. There are no canals in Michigan, and there are no canals in New York. There are no canels in Bridge and there are no canels in Venice (Venice is in the south. Therefore, you cannot find canals in Venice). Therefore, the only option that fits is Amsterdam.<n><n>#### Choice C-Amsterdam<n><n>### Input<n>The population of a town increases by 26%, decreases by 15%, and increases by 9%. The population this year is 9970 people.<n><n>### Response<n>This year, 9970-80% of 9970(9970 x 0.08 = 798.2)=7982.2<n><n>#### 7982.<n>### Rationale<n>If there is an increase, there will be a growth 26%<n>If there is a decrease, there will be a shrink 15%<n>There is an decrease this year, since 15% = 0.15 and 9970 x.15 = 1525.5<n><n>If there is an decrease or an increase, there will a growth or a shrink(growth & shrink)<n>1525.9+9970(growth+shrink)=7982<n><n>#### 26% decrease + 9% increase <n><n>### Input <n>An archipelago is an island group. Which of the following islands are part of the Philippines archipelago? A: Hawaii, B: Indonesia, C: Taiwan, D: Malaysia, E: Philippines.<n><n>### Input B:<n>A: Hawaii is not a part of any archipelago. There is no archipelago that is named Hawaii. If you did get Hawaii confused with an archipelago, then there is nothing to respond to.<n><n>However, the others are:<n><n>### B<n>* Indonesia: 13,466 islands<n>* Taiwan: (Roughly) 1,485 islands<n>* Malaysia
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What is a great place to lay in the sun? Choices:  A: in the basement B: west C: solar system D: beach E: beans<n><n>### Response:		<n>This response needs to use the "great place to lay in the s" and "to lay in the sun."<n><n>- You need to add "to" to the start of the response, and "in" to the response at the end of the answer.<n>- You can add "in the" at the start of the response<n><n>#### "in the basement"<n>- Basement is not a great place to lay.<n>- I would rather lay in the basement. It is a great place to be.<n>- We should not lay in the basement as it is not comfortable.<n><n>#### "in" is for beans and not for laying!<n>

It was in the Union of the United States in 1830 and it began by having 8 counties: Davidson, Robertson, Rutherford, Sumner, Wilson, Bedford, Lincoln and Smith. These counties were split into many smaller counties through time: Cheatham, Clay, Dickson, Giles, Houston, Loudon, Macon, Moore, Obion, St. Clair, Warren, and Fentress<n>But a fiddle can be found in musical store, dancehall (tap dance), orchestras, and in symphonies.<n><n>### Input:"I'm going to the book store to buy a grammar book. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What do drugs do? Choices:  A: damage B: cloud mind C: lower i.q D: cause illness E: cause accidents<n><n>### Response:		In drugs damage mind, cloud mind, lower i.q. also cause illness but not accidents<n><n>## Instruct-Response Format<n>A short set of instructions (up to 75 words) with the instruction prompt for the student to use the given information correctly.<n>Response: A response from the student to the requests provided in the prompt.<n><n>#### Examples<n>![](https://github.com/yulia-sht/Ascent-Bot/blob/master/assets/instruct_response_format_2.png)<n>![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/yuliasht/AscentBot/master/assets/multiplechoicebot_task.png)<n>![https://github.com](https://github. com/yuliasht)<n>## Feel<n>### Instructions<n>#### Sample 1<n>The students of the class were asked to participate in a charitable drive to collect food for homeless people. To boost donations from the students, the teacher gave them the opportunity to vote for their favorite way to deliver the food to the needy. One suggestion was that each student could bring one can of food to the classroom on the designated day. Another suggestion was that the entire class contribute an entire bag of food. The students voted for the second suggestion. Who benefited from the students’ charitable actions? Choose the answer that best completes the statement or answers the question.<n><n>#### Sample 2<n>The student asked me what her best subject should be. I asked her to focus on History and English instead of Math, Science and Reading. <n>#### Sample 3<n>The student asked me which of these subjects, Math, Science, Reading or History was better. I told her to ignore those topics and focus on her best subjects instead.<n>#### Sample 4<n>Write a response that suggests to the student to answer the question.<n><n>I can’t tell you whether to take History or Geography.<n><n>### Response<n>What do you prefer to take, Geography or History?<n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Can you name a good reason for attending school? Choices:  A: get smart B: boredom C: colds and flu D: taking tests E: spend time<n><n>### Response:		<n>Richard and Hurley are on their way to class and have a discussion about the importance of education.<n><n>**Richard:** “Can you name a good _reason_ for attending school?”  <n><n>**Hurley:** “I can give you a good _reason_ why _I_ attend school. I believe it is essential to attend class to _get smart_.”  <n><n>**Richard(in response to Hurley):** “I see your point, but _I_ do not only attend class for _my_ education. I attend class to _get_ smart and _stay_ smart.”<n><n>####  D.<n><n>##### [link](https://drive.google.com/viewer?usp=drivesdk&url=https://www.bccampus.ca/courses/20202/files/67215890_1584471398145_7234905742630393477_o.PNG?ts=636397818)<n><n>####  C.<n><n>##### I will go to school because I can avoid colds, I make friends and I have fun.<n><n>### Rational:<n><n>##### [Video](https://drive.googlersev.com/viewer.html?usp=drive_web#https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1wUAJ4m5xXU2_mZQxRqxRxoT8rLGm2s21wU_CiHBd3XU/edit)<n><n>###### #1

Orange hair<n><n>## Problem<n><n>Write a program that identifies and describes a person given first name, last name and their profession given as one word, e.g., "Mary is a nurse."<n>For example, if the prompt asks, “Is the cat a cat?”<n><n>The program should:<n>Identify a person whose profession matches the prompt word,<n>Identify the person’s name,<n>Identify the name by last name first,<n>Identify and describe the person by name and profession by providing the person’s last name and profession after the title "Is the (person's profession) (person's last name)?" (Is the nurse Smith?)<n><n>### Input<n>Enter first name and last name and profession:<n>"John is a doctor"<n>If the program receives a prompt that is all capital letters, such as "Is the cat cat?", or is a complete sentence instead of a word prompt, such as "Who is the doctor?" the program should do the following<n><n>## Output<n>The prompt will tell you the title you should use to answer the prompt, and the program should be able to use the prompt given to answer the prompts.<n>### The prompt should contain all lowercase letters or all capitals. If the prompt is all lowercase letters or capitals, the program should do the followings<n><n>## Output If the program receives a prompt with all lowercase letters or only uppercase letters, the program should:<n>*   Write that the person's name is John<n>*    Find and print the person's profession by last name<n><n>### If the program receives a complete sentence for the

(24=1+2+2+13, 36=1+3+5+7+9+11+13)<n>2. (57=1+3+7+9+41+43)<n>3. (76=1+3*75+2*)<n><n>#### 41*43*75=2*24*75*36*76=2+36+74+76<n>---<n><n>### Answer and comment<n><n>### Question:<n><n>### Demorstation:<n><n>Input: Every morning, Samantha leaves for school. She has a 15-minute walk to her school. If she leaves her house at 7:30 AM, how early does she need to get up in order for her to arrive at school at 8:00 AM?<n>Output: She needs to get up by 7:15 AM.<n><n>#### Answer:<n>Samantha has a 15 min walk to her school<n>She has to leave her house to begin her walk by 7:16 AM<n>Since she has to arrive by 8 AM<n>7:15+15 = 7:30<n>To cover the distance of 15 min that Samantha takes to reach her destinations<n>7:30+15 = 8:00<n><n>---<n>### Task description:<n><n>#### Instruct:<n><n><p><n>Answer the questions following to determine and discuss if an item is a <strong>square</strong>.<n></p><n><n>#### Input<n>There is a square object. It has a width of 4.9 cm and a height of 4.5 cm<n><p><n>Is it a <strong>square? </strong></p><n><n>#### Output<n><p><n>YES</p><n><n><p>Why is it a square?</p><n><n>Answer :<n>| 4.9 cm| * |<n>|-5 cm height|*| 4.9cm width|*(4.9cm)*|<n>| 4

Choices:  A: store B: classroom C: backpack D: cabinet E: teacher<n><n>### Response:		Backpack<n>### Demonstración:<n><n>* La clase de Richard es en la habitación A. Richard ha estado en la clase por cuatro años, cada semana y todos los días de la semana, por lo que sus clases ocupan una pequeña parte de su días. Richard nunca tiene sus clases en la A, ya que su clase siempre está en la clase B de Hurle.<n>* Hurle siempre transporta su clase en su bolsa. Hurley tiene una bolsa en cada clase que él toma, porque su clase A es la vez en la clase B. Si no tiene su clase en la A, entonces tiene su clase en el bolsillo.<n>* Richard puede ser encontrado en varios lugares fuera de su clase A. Para el caso de Richard, Richard tiene un buen día de viaje a la tarea y a la biblioteca. Richard viaja a la biblioteca porque su familia no le puede comprar libros<n><n>#### 6<n>Answer: 1<n><n>### Instrucción:Write an instruction that describes a common task. Create a response that appropriately demonstrates the given instruction.<n><div align=center><n>  <p> <img width=50% height=80% src="https://i.imgur.com/K5vHd1a.png"/> </p><n>  <p><i>Note:</i> Don't let your friends know if you are reading this question as it requires you to do so.</p><n></div><n><n>### Instantiation:Input: Write your name before each letter in a word. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where can meat last a long time? Choices:  A: backery B: ham sandwich C: fridge D: butcher shop E: freezer<n><n>### Response:		<n>- D: butcher shop<n><n>### Explain:<n>A backery is a type of establishment that makes and sells baked goods (i.e. bread). A ham sandwich stores well for over a month. A fridge stores vegetables that are good for a longer period of time.<n>A butcher shop sells meat that is fresh, and therefore it will not last a long time. A fridge does not store meat that is fresh. A freezer lasts longer, but only a little longer if you don't want to eat the meat soon.<n> <n>### Output:<n>Meat can last a long time in a fridge.<n><n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input<n>The first line will describe how long the person has been in charge of a company. The first line of the output should say which number of minutes the person has been in that position, and should follow with a line detailing what the person is eating now.<n>   <n>### Example<n>The first line reads, "I have been with Apple Computer for 5 hours"<n>  <n>The second line reads, <<Eating breakfast>>Breakfast.<n><n>### Output<n><n>Eating breakfast<n><n>#### 3<n>Answer: 3<n><n>### Input and Expected Output<n>Please refer to the below link<n>https://www.hackerrank.com/challenges/hackerrank-infinite-loop<n><n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What is a good result of losing weight? Choices: A: lost money B: bad hair days C: no one will talk about you at parties D: the world will know you.<n><n>#### A: lost money<n>C: no one will talk to you at parties<n>#### Choices<n>C: no one talks to you at parties<n>If an individual has not gained weight, they are likely too lose more money at parties and no one will talk at parties in general.<n>#### A: LOST MONEY<n>If an individual answers A, they will also see the benefits of losing money, because the world will not talk to them at parties because they are poor.<n><n>### Input<n> What is a good result from winning an award? This means Richard is 20 years old and Hurley is 4.<n>Next, We take away 24, so Richard is 24-24= <<24-24=-8>>-8 years old.<n>Hurley is 4 years old, so Hurley will be 4+40 =<< 4+40=44>>44 years old.<n><n>Next, take away 8 and 44, from Richard and Hurley so Richard is 8 and Hurley is 36,<n>So Richard is 8 years old and Hurley will be 36 years old in 40 years,<n>And in 40 years Richard will be 36+8 = 44 and Hurley will be Hurley will be 60 +8 = 68 years old.<n><n>Richard and Hurley have combined ages will be

Choices:  A: feel cold B: feel pressure C: feel bumpy D: itches E: feel clammy<n><n>### Response:		<n>If somebody pinches somebody else's skin, the skin will feel cold.<n>If someone's skin is held against a bumpy surface, that skin will feel bumpy.<n>If someone pinches someone's skin, that skin will itch.<n>When someone's skin is pinched, it will feel clammy.<n>If someone' pinches somebody else' skin, the skin will press against the skin of whomever is being pinched. That skin's pressure will increase.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>If someone is pinched, that person's skin will feel pressure.<n>When one person presses or grabs another, that other person's skin will touch the skin of the person doing the pinching. The skin touching should feel pressure increased from its original position.<n>If somebody pinches someone else's skin, that person's itchiness will increase slightly.<n>If somebody' skin is held against a smooth surface, that skin will have less pressure than on a bumpy surface.<n><n>### If one skin touches another skin, it will feel as if it will become sticky and soft.<n>### If one person is in a dark room, they will likely see better than someone in a brightly lit room.<n>### If somebody pinches somebody else, the other person, they will feel uncomfortable about their experience..<n>### If someone stretches a small space between their fingers, it's likely that their fingers will become cold.<n>### If someone's skin is stretched, its texture will become warped.<n>#### None of these answers are correct.<n>Answer: C: feel bummy<n><n>#### Answer: C: feel bumm<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Letters are sometimes delivered by hand through one of these. Choices:  A: mail box B: suitcase C: front door D: bowl E: post office<n><n>### Response:		A: mail box.<n><n>### Rationale<n>If you get a letter in the mail, you put it in the mail box.<n>If your letter does not fit in the mail box, you might put it in to a suitcase when you travel with the mail.<n>Post Offices mail out packages and if you do not want your mail delivered by hand, you place your letter in the mail box at the post office.<n>Rather than using the mail box or your mail box, you may use the front door to get the mail.<n>You are more likely to be given a letter if a friend is delivering your mail directly to you.<n>#### 1.<n>Answer:  A: mailbox<n><n>### Question:Which of these statements is true according to the passage? Choices: A: All the choices are true B: All the choices are false C: If you do not get your mail for 2 days, the postmaster will check out what happened to it. D: You will be liable for theft to the amount of your postal deposit if you lose a letter while it is in your possession.<n>### Rationale:<n>The statement that if you are looking for a lost mail is not mentioned in the passage.<n>The loss of a letter is not mentioned here.<n>The last line reads as 'Your post office has a responsibility to you to deliver your mail, and it can be fined and liable to the same extent as if a clerk had lost your mail.’. This indicates that if the post office is not able to deliver mail, it will be liable for it.<n>We know that it is not liable for all the mail that is lost which is indicated by the statement that<n>'The Post Office does not guarantee that there will be no losses.’.<n>It has responsibility for mails 'If a mail is lost through the postmaster's neglect, either wilful or due to incompetence, and not due in any way to the fault of the mailer, the postmaster is liable.' This statement is mentioned here.<n><n>#### 1. Answer: D: You will be responsible for theft to the extent of the post deposit if you lose your letters while it is in your custody.<n><n>### Note:<n>The statements are in order as<n>'If you do not get your mails for 2 days, your postmaster will look into it'
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The president had to make a decision regarding the hate attack on his country, what did he do? So they have to fight and do everything to prevent it from happening again.<n><n>### Input question: What did we want to do in our project? Choices:  A: cook dinner B: make bread C: eat in restaurant D: have lunch E: make bread<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Rationale:<n>Choices: A: cook dinner B<n>Choices: C: eat in restaurant<n>Choices: D: have lunch<n>Choices: E: make bread<n>Middle of the day implies noon or afternoon in which time for lunch time. So, answer is D: have lunch.<n><n><n><n><n><n>

Choice a and  choice d <n>is a correct answer for the task.<n><n>#### Ex.6 The teacher gave  homework to her student.The student need to bring in 15 math  problems completed  to make up  for the unfinished homework. <n><n>### Rationale: Since the student must bring in 15 completed math problem, it must be 15 problems  in total. However, he is slow.  If it takes him 10 minutes to walk 4 miles  each way at exactly the same time, how long will it take him to walk from his home to work 3 times a day?<n><n>### Racionales:<n>The task given say that he walks 10 minutes to reach his destination. It means that the man walks 4/(4+10) = 1/5 of mile in 10 minutes. It implies that if the man walks from his home to work in 10 minutes one time, he will reach his destination at the end of 5 minutes (of a mile  walked).<n>Since the man walks from home to work 3 time in a day, he need to walk for 3 times to reach his destination. Therefore, it will take him <n>3x3=9 minutes to walk from his home  to his work. <n><n>## Questions<n>### 1. Choices:  A: vomiting B: pleasure C: happiness D: contentment E: mess<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Solution:<n>The correct answer is "B".<n><n>#### Answer: <n>The correct answer is eating breakfast in bed does not make you feel pleasant or happy, which means "B" is the answer.<n><n>#### Reason:<n>Answer should be "B" not "E". When you have a problem on your exam or when you are trying to do something such as working on an assignment,<n>if you can solve the problem, it will bring you some contentment. It is also pleasant to solve problems and you may be very happy to have<n>problem solve too. You can also feel happiness eating breakfast in bed when you don't have any problems or the problems are not urgent or serious,<n>and if you have time to think carefully or think rationally about your problems, you may see the positive side of the problems or the problems.<n><n>### Commentary:<n>In the instruction, you may miss details with the problem of choosing correct answers, which may lead to the wrong answers selection.<n><n>### Revision:<n>What are the differences between "contentment" and "happiness"?<n><n>Contentment: To say that someone is very contented is to say that they are happy and/or pleased, <n>which means contentment means to be happy or be content to accept.<n><n>Happiness: To say that someone or something is happy means that they are content or they are pleased or satisfied, which is a condition of contentment or <n>satisfaction often associated with pleasure or luck, and it is a feeling of well being or pleasure of a good life.<n><n>### Note:<n>The word "contentment" comes from the word "content". The word "happiness" is related to the word "happy" too.<n><n>### Preparation time:<n>< 1 minute<n><n>### Answering time:<n>< 30 seconds<n><n>### Marks for this question:<n>< 5<n><n><n>### Previous question:<n>### 0594115396<n><n>### Next question:<n>### A0122897655<n><n><n><n><a href="https://Baidu.com" alt=""> <img src="https://assets01.baidu.com/static/bv1_img/200

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where would someone likely bring an attache case? Choices:  A: overhead compartment B: chair C: hospital D: in shirt E: business meeting<n><n>### Response:		<n>D: **Business meeting**<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a response that indicates what is contained in the box on the left.  Your response should <n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: Input: The difference in ages (in years) between Richard and Kara is the same as the difference in ages in years between Hurley and Kara. Richard and Kara had the same number of children.<n><n>Output: Hurley and Kara had two children. Their age difference was 6 years.<n><n>#### The question is asking how many years Hurley and Kara took care of their children.<n><n>### Output: Hurley and Kura had 2 children and their age difference between their age was 5 years<n><n>### Instructior to add input:<n>Write a response to this input that tells two ways to solve this problem. (Each line should contain the code for only 1 of the 2 solution.)  Your response should<n><n>### Demoscn:<n><n>Solution 1: First step is to know how many siblings we have. If we have 3 siblings, then we need to find the average of our age.<n>Second step is to find how many days of the week we wake up by taking the average of our age, and then divide it by 3. For example: For the average age of 27, and for 3 days, you divide the 27 by 3, you get 9 and multiply by 7 to get 63 for the sleep time of the week.<n><n>Solution 2: First step is to take Richard and Hurley's age, subtract that by 10, and divide that by 2 to get the average of the two differences. Second step is to take the average and subtract 10 to get the actual age difference you would have had for 10 years. We can now see why Richard is 5 years older than Hurley.<n><n>#### 27<n><n>Answer: 27<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The cabinets were imported from the south. John bought they because he knew that they would look good.  Where might they be installed? Choices:  A: kitchen B: pantry C: containing pots and pans D: in a flight E: mexico<n><n>### Response:		<n>The cabinets might be installed in the kitchen or pantry.<n>Kitchen: <Kitchen><n>Pantry: <Pantry><n><n>#### Kitchen:<n>The cabinets will be installed in the kitchen. The first box is checked.<n><n>#### Pantry:<n>The cabinets come from the south, so they will be placed in the pantry. The second box is checked.<n>The cabinets are a south and the kitchen is in the north of the cabinets. The cabinets will be found in the pantry.<n><n>#### Kitchen or pantry:<n>The cabiners may be found in either the kitchen or the pantry. The third box is checked.<n>It is not known until the cabinets are found where they will go. The fourth box is checked.<n>Where ever they go, the cabinets will look good.<n><n>#### Mexico:<n>The cabinets may have come from the south of Mexico, which is the cabinets come from the state of Mexico. Mexico is a south so it has a cabinets<n>The fifth box is checked.<n>

Choices:  A: indigestion B: died C: illness D: feel better E: throwing up<n><n>### Response:		Answer: B.<n>> This is a common example of the kind of thinking required in solving CLEAP Coding Questions.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Input: After eating a dinner of 3-4-0-1, what was felt 6-7-8-9-10-11?<n>Rationales 90: Input of 5 5 :<n>A. The answer: 100<n><n>5 5 3-4-9-10 11 3 10 5 5:<n>Answer:<n><n># Part 2<n>---<n>### Question:<n>How could you write a program that reads in a file and counts the number of times one number appears? <n><n>### Response<n>> Input the file.Count the number of times one value in the file. Output the result.<n>```<n>$ python number_in_file.py input.txt<n>Input File:<n><n>4<n>13<n>5<n>3<n>10<n>12<n>4<n>3<n><n>Number Of Each Number In File:<n><n>13 occurred [1 times]<n>5 occurred [3 times]<n>3 occurred [4 times]<n>10 occurred [1 times] <n>...<n>62 occurred [1 times]  <n>...<n>```<n><n>---<n>### Difference between Array and List?<n><n>*Arrays are fixed size <n>*Lists are flexible in size <n><n>---<n><n>### Task:<n>A number was randomly selected, and a second number was generated using the following formula: <n>```math<n>X=Y*2<n>```<n><n>*X represents the second number and *Y represents the first number.  <n>E.g. X=Y*2 - Y=x, X=2X <n><n>### Request: Write the CLEAP Python code to calculate the result.<n><n>### Task Solution:<n>Input: 6<n><n>X = 6 * 2 = 12<n><n>### Python Solution:<n>```python<n>import math, random<n><n>input_number = 6<n>input_number2 = random.randint(5,9)<n><n># X = 6 * 3<n>X = input_number * 2<n>print(X)<n>```<n><n>Output: 12<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where might I find unusual varieties of roses? Choices:  A: botanic garden B: flower garden C: backyard D: supermarket E: outdoors<n><n>### Response:		D.<n><n>### Explanation:An unusual variety of rose is one not commonly grown. Roses can be grown at home (in a backyard) by people who are interested. If they are not in a flower garden or botanic garden, they are in a backyard. If they are in a supermarket, they are not unusual. So A, B, and C are not correct. D is the answer

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where would you get a contraceptive if you do not have one? Choices:  A: health center B: vagina C: emergency room D: drawer E: medicine cabinet<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Input:Where would you get vagina? Choices: <n><n>### Response(write all letters):<n>C<n><n>### Explantion:<n>Input:Where do you put a condom? Choices:  B: vagina D: pocket  E: bedroom A: drawer C: bed B: medicine cabinet<n><n>#### <n><n>### Input：<n>My father bought the 12th most expensive computer in the store. My mother bought a $124,000 dress. Together they spent over $175,000. What was the most expensive computer in the electronics store where they bought their computers?<n><n>### Response：<n><n>My father bought a $12,400,000 computer and mother bought a $104,000 computer in the electronics stores.<n><n>### Rationale<n><n>### <n><n>### Expected results：<n><n>### Excerpt：(exclude spaces)<n>####<n><n>### Instructions：Answer this problem<n><n>### Problem description: (Include a diagram/table)<n><n>### My solution：<n><n>### Rationales：<n>### Expected result：<n>####<n><n>## Discussion<n><n>### Why?<n><n>### What was the most expensive part of writing this response? Choices: A: It was really sunny B: It was really dark C: It was really cold D: It was really wet<n><n>### Response:"Both"<n><n>### Rationels:  "Both the responses given by the text to the choices "It was really fun" and "It was really dark" are both acceptable, as "fun" and "dark" can be defined respectively as "pleasant" and "scary."<n>### Demination:(N/A) <n><n>Input:I will tell you one last thing, and then you will know this is the answer to what? A scabbard could be either a sheath or a collection.<n><n>### Input:(T): How many litters were there in each litter?<n>####  Choices:T: <<>>8<n><n>### Response:(O) : <<9>>16<n><n>### Reasons:There were 8 rabbits in 4 litters: <<3>>3=8 There were <<6>>6=12 there rabbits in 6 litters, which is the same number of rabbits,10 and 14=14.There were 8 rabbIt was given that 8 rabbits were in 4 litters. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The garage had light sensors and automatic doors, what kind of house was it? Choices:  A: modern house B: building C: townhouse D: neighbor's house E: downtown<n><n>### Response:		D<n>Rationales: The garage had light sensory and automatic doors which imply modern  house.<n>#### <n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n>There was a small bakery shop in a busy city. The shop was making cupcakes using 2 recipes. Choices:  A: cash register B: desk drawer C: pay envelope D: throw away E: box<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>A<n>```<n>#### <n>Answer: <n>### Answers:<n>**A:** Check is cashed at the cash register.<n>**B:** Check is placed in a desk drawer.<n>**C:** Check is placed into a pay envelope. You have to have one to cash the check.<n>**D:** Check is discarded. You receive no money until you turn it in.<n>**E:** A check is neither cashed nor used, just held in storage because you're waiting on a check.

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Billy bounced the ball off the wall.  There was a target on the wall for him to bounce against.  Where might he be? Choices:  A: pool table B: toy box C: playroom D: park E: closet<n><n>### Response:		<n>B: Pool table.<n>The choices are<n>B: Pool table<n>C: Playroom<n>D: Park<n>E: Closet<n>The text states that there was a target on the “wall”.  There is no mention of other objects with the target.  The author mentions “target on the wall” and nothing else, so “the wall” must be referring to the “wall” in the “playroom”, not one with different objects on it.<n>The text states<n>> Billy bounced the ball off B: <<Pool table>><n>> the wall.<n><n>And the text implies that the target can be found on “the wall”, so it is not reasonable that the target is on the playroom wall.<n><n>#### pool<n><n>### Comment:<n>> Billy bounced<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Billy bounced a ball off the wall. There was a target on one wall for him to bounced against. Where might he be?<n><n>C: Playroom <n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:what do you do before going to party? When the aliens finally find Earth, the invaders will destroy the whole planet regardless of the number of people. The invasion force begins at a fixed distance from Earth. It takes the invaders 1 minute to fly to Earth. How far from Earth should they be so that the Earth will be destroyed on the average in 154 minutes after the invasion?<n><n>### What is the average number of people on Earth?<n>Answer: 22,500,000<n><n>### The average number of people will not always be 3 digits because there might be lots of people living on Earth. If  Adele is 34 years old, what is their combined age 66 years  ago?<n>><n>> Rationales: If Adele is 21 years old, and the  difference in ages between Ariel and Adele is 9,  Ariel is 9+21 = <<9+21=30>>30 years old<n>> Forty years from the present, will be 30+66 = <<30+66=96>>96<n>> years old<n>> The combined ages forty years from the present will be 21+96 = <<21+96=117>>117<n>> years ago<n>><n>> >>\[C_{\text{40}}\cong 21+97\,\]<<>>97<n><n>### <n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where is a monkey likely to be found in the rainforest? Choices:  A: tree tops B: rain forest C: zoological gardens D: great outdoors E: zoo<n><n>### Response:		<n>Tree tops<n><n>#### Output:<n>A<n><n>#### Rationales:  <n>A tree tops<n>B Rain forest<n>C Zoo gardens<n><n>### Input:[Use the code from Example 1 to remove a string from an array of strings. In this program, you should remove the letter sequence ‘IAMNOTJOHANNASMARX.’ from the array of strings, keeping only those strings with ‘JOHN’ in the string.]<n><n>### Program:<n><n>### Rationales :<n><n>```shell<n>#!/usr/bin/env python2.7<n><n>import sys<n>from collections import Counter<n><n>if len(sys.argv) is not 2:<n>    print "Invalid arguments, please enter one file, and one string"<n>    sys.exit()<n><n>n, text = Counter([' ']+sys.argv[1]).keys()<n><n>a = [i for i in range(n)] #array<n><n>for x in a:<n>    s =''.join([i for i in range (x+1)])#combinations<n>    if s in text:<n>        print x,<n>```

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The animals weren't good at swimming, so it was hard for them to do what? Choices:  A: pass water B: bathe C: listen to each other D: feel pleasure E: reproduce asexually<n><n>### Response:		Choice: D<n><n>### Answer: <n><n>### Rationales: If the animals weren't doing what? they weren't good (choice: do or at) at swimming<n>If animals weren't swimming, they couldn't pass water (choice A).<n>If animals weren’t swimming, they wouldn’t be able bathe (choice B).<n>If animals wern’t swimming,they wouldn’t be able listen to each other (choice C).<n>If animals werren’t swimming they wouldn’t be abale to feel pleasure (Choice D).<n>If the animals weren’t at swimming, they wouldn't be able to reproduce asexually (Choice E).<n>So the correct choice is (choice D)<n><n>### Sample Output:<n><n>### A)<n><n>```<n>A: The animals weren't able to pass water, so it was hard to do what?<n>```<n><n>### B)<n>```<n>B: The animals weren’t able bathe so it was hard to?<n>```<n><n>```<n>B: So it was hard to do?<n>```<n><n><n>### C)<n>```<n>C: The animals weren‘t able to listen to each other, so it was hard?<n>```<n><n>/**/<n><n>### D)<n>```<n>D: The animals weren`t able? <n>```<n><n>## Reference:<n>- [English Tutor](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0h0gEO1-xqU&feature=youtu.be)<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What could there be in a beauty salon? Choices:  A: city B: strip mall C: clerk D: neighborhood E: rooster<n><n>### Response:		Beauty Salon<n><n>####  ------<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input The sum of a pair of twins is 30. If the age of the younger twin is 30% larger than the older twin’s age, what is their age difference?<n><n>### Response<n><n>Let younger twin’s age = x younger twin’s %age larger younger twin’sage= (X+2)%<n>Let older twin’s = (X-2)%<n><n>The difference between twin’s =(X-x)<n>Sum of each twins =30<n>(x-x)+older twin’s = 30<n>2x+older twin’s=30<n>older twin’s=(2x+30)-2<n>older twin’sdifference = (2x+30-2)-(x+2) -(2x+30)+(x+2)-<n><n>X+2 x+2X+2 <n><n>X+2(x+2) <n><n>older twin’ssum = X+1+(2x+12)<n><n>older twinssum = [(x+2)+(2x)]<n><n>older twinspair sum = [[x+2]+[(2x+12)]]<n><n>[[x+2]+[(+x)][(2x+12)](-x)]  -(x)^2]<n><n>older twin pear sum =[(x+2)+(x^2)] = (x+(x^2))<n><n>older twins sum = (x^2+2x)<n><n>2x+x^2 <n><n>3x<n><n>Answer: The older twin’s sum = the younger twin’s sum + ((2x-2)-1)(2x+4) = (x^3 – 2x^2 + 2x)(x + 4)<n><n>older twins = (3x^2–3x–1)(3x+4)<n><n>I can’t figure out how to write a math equation on this text box since 3x^2–[2-1]+1=3x^3–4x^2+3x+1-1<n><n>1<n><n>4<n><n>Answer = (3

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where can you buy a fishing rod? Choices:  A: furniture store B: fishing camp C: hardware store D: sporting goods store E: engine<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Demo:<n>Let f(x) represent the number of fishing rods you can by in a hardware store at x dollars, where x is any number.<n>f(1) =0 f(2) =1<n>f(3) =2<n>f(4) =0<n>f(5) =2<n>f(-1)=1 f(-2) =3 f(-3)=5<n>f(...) =?<n><n>Let ƒ(x) represent the amount of money you can spend at a furniture store at x dollars, ƒ(1)=00ƒ(2) =10ƒ(3) =20ƒ(4)=00ƒ(...) =?ƒ(()=0ƒ(())?<n><n>Let g(x) represent the average cost at a sporting goods store if you spend x dollars, g(1)=0.258, g(2)=0.375<n>Let G(x) represent the cost of fishing for 4 hours, G(1/2=0<n>Let H(x) represent the profit you make if you fish for 4hours, and sell it for x dollars at the hardware store, H(1/2=1.5<n>Let h(x) be the cost to buy a fishing polt in a fishing camp, h(1/2=4h(()= 1.6<n>Choosing the correct answer involves 1) knowing/comparing what you get in each type of store: <n>f(-x)=f(-(-1)) =f(1)<n>ƒ((-2)) = ƒ(2)<n>ƒ((-n)) = ƒ(n) for all n<n>ƒ(∞) = ƒ(∞)<n>ƒ(x) is a function and has only one value at each input x.<n>ƒ(x) > ƒ(y), then \(f(x) ≥ f(y)\)<n>ƒ(x) < ƒ(y), ƒ(x) < f(y)<n>ƒ(x)(0 is the y-intercept, if ƒ(x)=0) is a continuous function<n>ƒ(-x)>x<n>ƒ(-x)=ƒ(x)<n>g(x) ≥, g(x) <, g(x) ⨉<n>g(x) is a continuous function
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What city in the middle east is known for a temple? Choices:  A: jerusalem B: texas C: middle east D: china E: india<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**A**<n><n>### Reasoning:<n><n>### Input The best way to describe the difference between a set of numbers is _____.<n><n>### Reconing:<n>**ANSWER:** If you took the numbers from the largest to smallest, the difference between them would be the average of the two numbers. The average of the set of numbers is the difference between them. <n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>### Revisit:<n><n><n>### Practice:<n>**A:** Average of 5<n>**In:** 7<n>**F = 7 - 5 = 2**<n><n>### Additional Questions:<n>Q1 What are the only two negative numbers? Q2 What are the only two even numbers?<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The helm is not something you wear on your head. Rather, it moves the masts on what? Choices:  A: sailing vessel B: paddleboat C: ship D: motorboat E: tugboat<n><n>### Response:		<n>If you choose Option A, paddleboat, then your answer is incorrect. A helm is an operating platform that controls the steering of a vessel. A paddleboat has no masts; it is a flat-bottomed boat propelled by being scraped along by the paddles controlled from the deck.<n><n>If you select choices B through E, all of these are ships, not vessels. The answer is Option C.<n>#### 2<n>Answer: C<n><n>### Instructions:<n>You have 3 questions to answer.<n>Choices:<n>Forty-Two<n>66<n>Seventy-Eight<n>82<n>Thirteen<n>#### 13<n>Answer: 13<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>You have an additional 4 questions you need to answer correctly.<n><n>#### 2<n>Choice: The man was going down into the pit to get fresh water.<n>Answer: 43<n><n>#### 4<n>Choice: The man is the only person in the group who is left handed.<n>Answer: 62<n><n>#### 14<n>Answer: 56<n><n>### Instutions:<n>You have one more to answer for a total of 7 questions.<n><n>#### 45<n>Choice: The letter the man had just received was an invitation to his brother's wedding.<n>Answer: 54<n><n>### Inputs:<n>The old man in the car is driving to town. When he gets there, he parks on the right side of the street, opposite a caf�. Once out of the car, the old man notices all the lights on the street are turned off. It does not specify the place. <n>So, the answer should be E (great outdoors), and the location given are toy store, zoological gardens, tree tops, rain forest, and great outdoors. <n>In a general sense, a captive monkey does not refer to a specific place.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:If someone is outgoing what are they likely to seek? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where can you purchase food and eat it at tables? Choices:  A: house B: fast food restaurant C: library D: conference E: paper<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input:(What is this object?) Choices:  A. table B. floor mat C. table cloth D. rug E. napkin F. all of these are not tables.<n><n>### Rationales:Tablecloths are fabric, so they're not tables. Table, floor mat, and rug are possible choices for objects used/found at tables. No object other than a table can be found under all of these choices. The floor mat and rug are on the floor. If there is a table, it is on it. Floor mat and rug are placed on tables. They cannot be used or found under the table as a choice. The floor mat can be used on a table, so it’s not a floor mat that’s used or found under a table. The rug can be used on a floor, so the rug can be used or found under a floor, so it’s neither a table or a floor.<n><n>#### Tablecloth (1): <n><n>### Rationale:A napkin is used, but a napkin is not a table. A table doesn't lay flat, so a tablecloth isn't a tablecloth if it's folded into thirds so it's flat. If it's not on a table, it's called a tablecloth. If there was a napkin with its third fold still on it, it's called it's still on it's napkin ring, it's a napkin.<n><n>#### Table (1):<n><n>### Ratios:When something is said to be on top of a thing, it's a table.<n><n>#### Table:<n><n>### Rations:The definition for a table is not the same for every object.<n><n>### Response:(what is this?) Choices: A. tablecloth B. floor mat C D. rug E. a napkin F. all not tables<n><n>#### Tableclotn (2)<n><n>### Ration:a 2. A 2. F<n><n>#### Table<n><n>### Response (what is this?) Choice: A, floor mat B table C, Rug D, All are not table<n><n>### Rattlesnake:The only reason A and D were in there is because they weren’t choices. They were excluded because the object

The program encrypts the first text in the first file.<n><n>It goes to the second file to encrypt the second text, skipping the first already encrypted.<n><n>**Example:** We encrypt the following two texts.<n><n>> Hello. I am a student.<n>> Hello. That is how it works.<n><n>The plain text is:<n><n>```<n>Hello. I am a student<n>Hello. That is how it work<n>```<n><n>Then we write it like this:<n><n>```<n>HELLO. I AM  A STUDENT.<n>HELLO. THAT  IS HOW IT WORKS<n>```<n><n>If we encrypt the texts again, nothing will change, because we are already at the end.<n><n>```<n>Hello-I-a-student<n>Hello-is-how-it-works<n>```<n>We can encrypt the same pair of texts many times and the output will

Choices:  A: factory B: school C: grocery store D: band E: aircraft<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer to the question above is Choice D<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Manufacturing operations include factories, warehousing and logistics, packaging, design, and more. A human wouldn't expect to find any of these operations in a school or grocery store.<n><n>### Input : What does a high "hit rate" mean in the context of cybersecurity? Choices: 1: an alarm sounding 2: an intruder detected 3: an employee fired 4: software breach 5: a high priority alert<n><n>### Response :<n>The correct answer to this question is number 3 above.<n><n>### Examples  :<n>Hit rate indicates the rate at which security software is detecting intruders. For any given piece of software, a low rate would mean it's not picking up many intruders. This may mean the software isn't adequate or it may mean the software needs to be updated.<n><n>### What type of organization is most commonly the target of a ransomware attack?<n><n>### Choices : 1: non-profit 2: retail 3: educational institution 4: healthcare organization 5: government 6: business<n>\begin{itemize}<n>\item The correct answer to this question above is Choice number 6.<n>\end{itemize}<n><n>### Explination :<n>Most ransomware attacks are targeted at businesses. This is because businesses generally have more data than other organizations, including financial and human resources data. Healthcare organizations are also a common target because they typically store sensitive medical information, making it a desirable target for attackers.<n><n>### Which network protocol is a common way to exchange emails and newsgroup communications?<n>\begin{itemize}\item The correct answer to the above question is Choice number 2.<n>\item In the following questions: 2.2.1.1 What type of organization is commonly the target of a spear-phishing attack?  2.2.1 What type of security software is often used in enterprise-level organizations?.<n>\item The correct answers to the questions above could be (Choices 1,2 and 3) 4-6.<n>\end {itemize}<n>\end{code}<n><n>##

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:James used the cannon to shoot at something while seeking lunch. (A) If the number of employees of a department is $46$, $35$, $28$, what is the number of employees in that department?<n><n>Rationales: The answer is $46$, because $46$ is  the smallest number out of the given $3$ numbers.<n><n>2. (A) For the given diagram, find the missing angles.<n><n>Rationales<n>If line $a$ is angle $AAB$, line $b$ is angle $DBA$, angle $AB$ = $62^\circ$ and angle $AD$ = $57^\circ$, then $DBA=62^\circ+ 57^\circ - 360^\circ/2 = 178^\circ - 32^\circ \approx 146^\circ$<n><n>3. (A) What is $m$ as a unit in $\frac{1}{m}$= $10$?<n><n>Answer: The unit is $10$<n><n>4. (A) What fraction of four quarters is $1$\frac{1}{4}$?<n><n>Rational: An indefinite number is written as a fraction, and it cannot be expressed with a denominator. It means that the value of the fraction can never be calculated since it can never divide by a number. The value of a fraction can only be equal to that of the number on the denominator. In this case, it is $143/25$<n><n>5. (A) If $a=2x+5$, then $a\cdot 3=?$<n><n>Rational:<n>$$a=2x+ 5 = 2(2x+5) + 5$$<n>then $a\cdot3=2(6x+15) + 10$, which = $12x + 30 + 10$<n>answer= $131x+40$<n><n>6. (A) What does $\frac{1}{21}\cdot \frac{1}{81} + \frac{1}{ 31}\cdot \frac<n>{11

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What would a person do if he or she just woke up? I have to think about the name for a few minutes.<n><n><n>## A few other things I've learned<n><n>* The key skill in writing clear instructions is providing enough information that there is only one reasonable answer. It's very easy to write something like<n>  * I need help cleaning rooms.<n>and expect the other person to know *exactly* what that means. <n>* It's very difficult to accurately quantify how much time something will take or how complicated it is. <n>  * "It's complicated..."<n>  * "If it takes more than 2 hours, we need to discuss it."<n>  * "Sending instructions to each other via text is the most efficient method available"<n><n><n><n>#### How can we help each other learn better?<n><n><n><n><n><n>### What should I know?<n>>Write instructions that describe an answer that is completely obvious to you and that takes up as much time as time as you need to describe it.  <n>  * What will you be learning?<n>  <n>><n><n><n><n><n>

What is the minimum number of points 85 / 300 = 0.28 = <<0.28= 28>>28  points that you can reach.<n>You completed it on March 22, so 85 / 40 = 2.125 = <<2.125= 21.25>> 21.27 points. You want to book a 1.5 hours helicopter tour which is 20 Euros per adult and 12 Euros per child. You will book the tour before your departure date, and you are flexible about the time to take the tour. Based on the information given below, you want to book a time slot that maximises your savings (minimum Euros spent).<n>*For each of the following questions, write a response that properly completes the request. You can assume that all dates are bookable and all choices are possible. Each person can fit into any age range and the total amount of people can fit in each age range.<n><n>### Part 1: A: How many persons can be in the age range [31, 35]? Choices: A-1 B-1 C-3 D-4 E-6<n><n>### Part I: B: How many persons can fit in the [0, 4] age range? Choices: A. 1 B. 2 C. 3 D. 4 E. Cannot answer.<n><n>### A - 2 adults, 3 children can be in the age 31-35 age range<n><n>### B - 3 adults can be in the age <4><n><n>## Task 2: Instructions<n>For each of the questions below, write a response that answers the question appropriately.<n><n>## Task 3: Instructions<n>You are going to create a list of numbers using two sets of data. The first data set should be named ‘NumberOfHeroes’ and the second data set should be named NumberOfStories
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:It had a beach with shallow water, while not the ocean this was a hot spot all the locals enjoyed on the what? Choices:  A: swimming pool B: pond C: lake D: bathe in E: childrens pool<n><n>### Response:		<n>If the locals loved it on the beach, then it's a beach. (B)<n>#### pond<n><n>### Instructions: Write a sentence that uses the word "swab".<n>**Do not write "swabbing,"** unless that is a correct grammar usage. Do not write the "b" in "swab" as a lower-case b if the upper-case "B" in "swabbing" is correct grammatically. There's an extra 'b' in "swabbing."<n><n>```<n>The doctor uses a swab to clean the cut.<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:In what place could you find air that has been breathed by many people recently? Choices:  A: charming B: space shuttle C: house D: train station E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Rationale:<n>You could likely find air that has been recently breathed in a house or inside a car.<n>A space shuttle is often filled with air pumped into it. But the air has not been breathed lately.<n>Air on the surface of the earth has many bacteria. Therefore it is not recommended to touch the air on the surface of the Earth.<n>Likewise you would be unlikely to breathe in air while riding a train. <n>Therefore your best bet would be to inhale air in a house or car, which have not been recently breathed in. <n>#### 1<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input<n>How many days of the week do you have available to you for use during a two week long vacation?<n><n>### Response option: <n>If you do not have as many days as you need to vacation during two weeks, you will have to take two weekends off of work. Therefore your best bet to take two weeks off of work would be by taking two Friday's off of work and two Monday's off of work (not Saturday's).<n><n>### However, you do have the option of taking three days a week off of work, so in my response I will choose option 3 days off of work using Monday through Wednesday.<n><n>### One last thing to realize is that if you take Monday off of work and then a Friday off of work, you will be off of work for 3 days total.<n><n>```<n>If the Monday you take off of work is also the Monday of your vacation, you will be out of the office for four days.<n>```<n>As I have already made this decision, I will only be considering taking two days of Monday's off of of work.<n><n>### I will also assume we are going to work with 5 day work weeks<n><n>### If we take into account the four and three day vacation scenarios, we could in fact only take two days off of work (Friday and Monday).<n><n>### With the correct combination of days each week, we can take 10 weeks off of work within two weeks.<n><n>### The remaining number of days to take off of work over two weeks is 60 minus 10 = 50 days.<n><n>### However we need 12 days off

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:A person would carry a large netted drawstring bag to what sort of place? Choices:  A: airport B: car C: jewelry store D: garbage can E: laundry room<n><n>### Response:		A)E<n><n># Task:<n>Write a code that has them input the name of the store, the quantity of merchandise stolen, the total value of the stolen merchandise, the time the theft occurred, and the name of the store.<n><n>### Example Input:<n>The store name is "Pet Shop." The quantity of merchandize stolen is 8. The total value of the stollen merchandize is 500. The time the theft occurred is 2 PM. The store is called "Toy Store."<n><n>### Example Output:<n>The theft occurred at 2 PM on July 29 2020.<n><n># Demonstration<n><n># Instruction <n><n>### Instuction:<n>What is the value of (48 * 28)?<n><n>### Answer:<n>48*28 = <<48*28=1264>><n><n><n># Task<n><n>Write a code that evaluates the expressions.<n><n># Examples<n><n>```<n>48*24<n>1264<n><n>(4*6)+(7*4)<n>66<n><n>(7*4)/2<n>35<n>```<n><n># Solution<n><n>```C++<n>#include <iostream><n>#include<cmath><n>using namespace std;<n><n>int main()<n>{<n>    int x;<n>    int y;<n>    float a,b,c,d,e;<n>    double f;<n><n>    cout<<"Enter x and y"<<endl;<n><n>    cin>>x>>y;<n><n>    a=48;<n>    b=24;<n><n>    f=(48*24)/(double)24;<n><n><n>    cout<<f;<n><n><n><n>    return 0;<n>}<n>```<n># Task<n><n><n>Write a program that asks the user how far she has traveled (input a number) this year. <n><n>Then, ask the user how much money she spent on fuel this year. <n>	<n>Next, ask the user how many hours she has worked this year.<n><n>Finally, calculate the total cost of the gas used in the number of miles she has traveled multiplied by the price of the gas.

How do you solve this division?<n><n>Answer: 9 divided by 7<n><n>#### Correct<n><n>9 divided by 7 =<n><n>9 / 7 = <<9 / 7 = 1 and 2>>1 and 2 <n><n>#### Incorrect<n><n>Answer: 7 divided by 3 = 7/3<n><n>7 / 3 =<n><n>7 / 2 = <<7 / 2 = 3 and 2>>3 and 2<n><n>### B. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The wind tore off the shingles, what was the wind like? On what would day would the coach train his students and how many lessons would he give?<n><n>### Rationale:<n>Day1: Give a lesson for 9 times (once for 1 week)<n>Day2: Do not give a lesson<n>Day3 to 8: Give a lesson (once a week)<n>Then, day 9: Give lesson one more time for 9 times (because of week 1 and month 1)<n>Thus, every 10 days, the coach trains his student 9 times.<n><n>### Response 1 Answer<n>Coach trains his student on Day 9, by giving lesson nine again for 9 times = 9<n><n>### Response2. 1st Answer<n>If you want to train the student once every ten days, you must train him on day 10th or 20th.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>Day 10: Give lesson on 10 (once for ten days)<n>Day 11 to 19: Do not give lesson<n>Then, day 20: Give lesson for 10 times (because of 10 days)<n><n>### Response1.2 Answer<n>If you want t to train the student once in ten days, you must give him lesson on Day 30 (once for 10 days).<n><n>### Input On what date was the president elected

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:During the brainstorming session there was a lot of talking and what? Choices:  A: obtaining information B: exchange of ideas C: sharing information D: conversation E: gathhering of information<n><n>### Response:		<n>E<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Choices: B: A: C: D: E:<n><n>#### E<n><n>Answer: E<n><n>### Response 2:<n>Answer: 24<n><n>### Instructior: Choose the correct option.<n><n>### Choice 1: A: The value of π to 8 digits after the decimal point and the exact number of digits in a second. B: The number of minutes in a year, the exact value of a second, and the exact number of minutes in a second. C: The exact number of seconds in a day. D: This option does not exist.<n><n>### Answer:<n>C<n><n>### Instrumenteration:<n><n>### C<n><n>Answer: C<n><n>### Instuctions: Answer the following multiple choice question.(If there is no question)<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: A triangle has a side that equals 15 centimeters and is not 90 degrees. If the shorter side of the triangle has length <<1-RATIONAL-1-TO-3>>1, what is the perimeter of the triangle?<n><n><n>### Rationales: A triangle has a <<1-RATIONA-1-TO-10>>1,000-centimeter side, and the <<2>>2 centimeter side is <<3>>3 centimeters shorter. So the <<3>>3 centimeter side is <<4>>4 centimeters. The <<4>>4 centimeter side is <<6>>6 centimeters. The shortest side of the triangle is <<6>>6, and the <<7>>7 centimeter side is the <<8>>8 centimeter side, all of which is <<9>>9 centimeters.<n><n>The <<9>>9-centimeter side is <<10>>10 centimeters. The shorter side is the <<11>>11 centimeter side.<n><n>The sides all make up the <<6>>6 to <<15>>15-centimeter side, or <<16>>16 centimeters in length.<n><n>The perimeter of the triangle in question is <<16>>15 centimetres, or <<16+3>>54,47213468,34885

Choices:  A: park B: in the ground C: hedgerow D: temperate climate E: botanical gardens<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>#### 761<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input:"What's that smell?" asked Mary.<n>The question should have read: "What did Mary say?"<n>A. What does the word asked in this context mean? B. Mary asked a question.<n>What's the question that is being asked? C. What's this smell? D. Which smell?<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Asked is an intransitive verb, meaning, it requires no object to complete the meaning. Mary asked the question. Mary told a question or asked a question. The smell is the object. Therefore, the question would have been, "What's that smelly?"<n>I chose answer A<n><n>#### 5200<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input"She said, "Were you in my class last year?"<n><n>The word'she' is a pronoun.  It has no article preceding it. According to the usage of such pronouns, which of the following words would you expect to fill in the first quotation mark following 'She said'?  Choices:  A. a B. an <n><n>### Rationale:An adjective modifies a noun or a pronoun. A pronoun is a word that acts as a substitue for a noun in a sentence. A pronoun is replaced with an adjective, if there is an article infront of it.<n>No article is infront of'she', therefore the word must be a pronoun. There is no noun or pronoun called'she'. Therefore, pronoun refers to.<n>I chose answer B<n><n>#### 66.6<n>Answer: C<n><n>### Input "She went to the library with me."<n>What did the speaker say?<n><n>### ResponseA. she was with the speaker B. the speaker was with he C. she went with the speaker D. she went to the library with the speaker<n><n>### Rationela:She is not actually saying what the speaker's statement is, the sentence does not convey that meaning.<n>I chose answer D<n><n>#### 388<n>Answer: B<n>Explanation:  Bella would have been speaking and would not be answering herself.<n>I chose answer C<n>

John preferred glass, and wished he was somewhere else.  Where does he want to be? Choices:  A: cupboard B: anywhere else C: everything D: own home E: garbage dump<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Explanation:The jar was platic, but not all the rest of the stuff in the KItchen is plastic.  John prefers glass, and therefore he wishes he was anywhere else.<n>A) Cupboard = John is in the kitchen<n>B) Anywhere else = John is not in the kitchen<n>C) Everything = No cupboards or garbage dumps have anything to do with John<n>D) His own home = He's either in his own home or not<n>E) Trash.  We know that John prefers glass over platic, therefore his home doesn't count as glass, and garbage dumps deal with trash.<n>This leads me to A, anywhere else.<n><n>### Input<n>1) How much did they spend on their new bed? (50)  What is the total cost of the new bed including tax?<n><n>### Response<n><n>500 + 300 = <<500 + 200 =700>>700 dollars and 400$ is 700.<n><n>### Explantation<n>They bought their new bed for 500+$ and their old one for 300$, now that they have the new bed the sales tax is 400$ leaving them with a 700$ total cost.<n><n>#### 1)<n>700 and 200 dollars respectively<n><n>### Solution for 1)<n><n>500 dollars + 300 dollars =<<500 + 100 = 600>>600 dollars.<n><n>### Solution 2)<n><n>50 + 700 =<<50 + 7 =700>>$700.<n>700 + 70 =<<700 + 6 =760>>$760.<n><n>## Additional Examples<n><n>#### The jar was plastic, the jar was plastic, like most of the stuff, like most of the things, in the kitchen..<n>Response: the jar was plastic<n><n>Comment: What is the answer?<n><n>Comment: Answer: A (Where does John wish he was

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What type of person typically contracts illness? Choices:  A: hospital B: head C: sick person D: elderly person E: doctor's office<n><n>### Response:		If someone is in the doctor's office, that person might become ill.<n><n>### Input What country is a leading supplier of cotton? Choices: A: India B: Egypt C: USA D: Afghanistan E: Spain<n><n>### Response In an article published by the Department of Agriculture, one of the leading suppliers of cotton is USA.<n><n>### Question:  When should I start building a budget?<n><n>### Response I should start building a budget so I have enough to spend money on the things I need.<n><n>### Example 7.5: Question: How much is the largest number you can represent in Base 8? Answer: <<7>>7<n><n>### Auxiliary language:<n>In this auxiliary language, base 8 means that each number represents the value of the digit to the left with the digit to the right being the value plus 1 (1 + 7 = 8).<n><n>### Example:<n>To represent the number <<7>>7, you do not add 1, because there is no digit to the right. (If the number was <<7>>77, the digit to the right would be 7+1 = 8.<n><n>### A:  Example 7.5 continued: The digit to the left of <<7>>7 is 5, so the value would be 5+1 = <<6>>6.<n><n>#### 30<n>
