Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What is the only was to recover from exhaustion? Choices:  A: mediate B: have rest C: stay in bed D: run out of steam E: go to sleep<n><n>### Response:		2<n><n>### Correct answer: 2<n><n>Answer (D)<n><n>**Input:The difference in ages between Richard Hurley is 26. If Richard is now years old what are their combined years from now?**<n><n>Input:- Richard and Hurley are both 20 years old.<n><n>Now,Richard is now year old and Hurley is 16 years old<n><n>From the above  we can easily find that the difference in age between Richard and Hurley will not become same if and only when their ages become 40 to 50, then only they will have 2 year of difference in ages.Hence, the age of Richard will become 21 and Hurley’s age will become 17.<n><n>\(40-50=10\)\(21-17=4\)<n><n>\(Richard(21)+Hurley(17)={38+17=55}\)\(Richard(26)+Hurley(26)={50+26=76}\)<n><n>From the above \(40-50=\) we can easily find that their combined years will be 33 in the year 2940 or 33 years in the year 2040.<n><n>Answer (E) and Answer (B) are also right because there is no any other option left to recover from exhaustion.<n><n>Answer (A) should be wrong because there is no use of any method to meditate if it becomes necessary to recover from exhaustion, because the recovery process will take much time.<n><n>Answer (C) should be wrong because it is not possible to stay in a bad or in a comfortable bed in order to recover from exhaustion because a comfortable bed can help only to keep calm the muscles or the brain but can’t help to recover from an exhaustion which needs a process of recovery to reduce anxiety, stress etc…<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where could you see an advertisement while reading news? Choices:  A: television B: bus C: email D: web page E: la ville<n><n>### Response:		The answer for this question is A and D.<n>#### A : Television<n>Télévision, or TV in English, is a telecommunication medium that is used for transmitting and receiving moving images and sound.<n>You can see an advertisement on television channel.<n><n>#### D : Web Page<n>Un web page (en anglais web page) est un document constitué d’un ensemble de fiches hypertextuelles. Les principaux documents Web sont des pages et des documents de recherche, des pages de fiches (en anglais « resource page »). Des ressources Web sont généralement accessibles depuis un même navigateur.<n><n>#### Détails:<n>* Television<n>* Web Page<n>* Bus<n>Buses are available on all major roads and are reasonably priced. These are operated by a large number of commercial and private operators. They travel mainly between main cities, suburbs and towns and run up to 365 days a year.<n><n>* E mail<n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Jamie wanted to reduce her waist size, but all of her efforts failed miserably. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:"There are 10 apples on an apple tree. An abbreviation is a shortened form (contraction). Abbreviation also refers to shortened form. For example, the term ABC stands for anterio-balloon complex. The term is an abbreviation of the words 'anterio', 'balloon' and 'complex'.

Choices:  A: economic instability B: not noticeable C: spend more D: rising interest rates E: boring<n><n>### Response:		Increased buying power<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the multiple choice question.<n>An increase in aggregate demand could be caused by any of the following, except:<n><n>#### 1: increased government spending <n><n>#### 2: increased export sales <n><n>#### 3: a decrease in the real value of the currency <n><n>#### 4: an increase in the money supply<n><n><n>### Input answer: An increase in the money supply.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>The money supply is directly controlled by monetary authorities and can therefore be changed at will.<n><n>### Aggregate demand<n><n>Aggregate Demand (AD) can be defined as: \[ AD = c + I + G + (M - X) \]<n><n>#### 1. Consumption (c) (D)<n><n>Consumption is the total expenditure for consumer goods and services done by households. The consumption line is an aggregate demand line that measures the total spending on real Gross Domestic Product or the level of Gross Domestic Product. This expenditure reflects the total economic behavior of the households (individuals). The lower of the consumption line is from consumption spending which reflects the purchases of the non-durables. Purchases of food, clothing, and fuels. The higher is from consumption spending reflects the purchases for durable goods such as the purchase of equipment, automobiles, etc.<n><n>#### 2. Investment (I) <n><n>During 2009, the government increased its spending on public infrastructure by $100 billion. This is an example of the government sector: \[ G = p+T+X \]<n><n>#### 3. Government (G) (D)

If 40% fewer salesperson are working as compared to before, how much has the average salary for a Chicago salesperson gone down?<n>Answer Choices: A: 10 B: 4.5 C: 20 D: 16.5 E: 25.5<n><n>> **Solution:** We use the average salary for Chicago of $100,000-$101,00=$4,500. For Illinois we use the average of that minus $1000 to get $90,000-10,000=$80,000 Then we get the new salary by subtracting 40% which is $32,000 from the Illinois average making it $80,00-$32,00=48,000. Then add back what we subtracted from the previous salary of Chicago, which is $10,500, leaving us with$48,00$+10,50=58,500<n><n>* I did not complete the full problem due to time<n><n>### InputFor the last three days, the temperature in 5 major cities has averaged 2 degree F warmer than the normal. Pi is about 3.14.  A is a number. Let pi equal A.<n>Rationales: Let A = Pi.<n>3.14 is equal to pi.<n><n>#### 43<n>### Input: There's no one single way to teach children math. There's different ways to approach the same type of math.<n>The answer is: C<n><n>### A math teacher may use different methods to teach math skills. A math teacher may show the formula, and have the students explain what the formula is, and why. A math teacher may have the student write down the formula; or the students explain what the math rule is. A math teacher may give the students a set of values, and the students solve for the missing values.<n><n>#### 19<n>### Input: 3x+13 is a linear equation and a quadratic equation is a, but a x is an exponent expression.<n><n>### Response<n><n>a: is not the right answer. A, b and c are all not right choice. D is correct<n><n>#### 36<n>### Input: Fibonacci is a sequence of numbers in which each number is the sum of the previous two numbers.<n><n>### Answer<n><n>D : The Fibonacci series is an arithmetic sequence in which each number after the first two is the sum of the two preceding numbers. In a Fibonacci sequence, the first two numbers in the sequence are 0 and 1, then each new number is the sum of two preceding ones: 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, … A Fibonacci sequence is named after an Italian mathematician Leonardo Pisano Fibonacci whose book Liber Abaci printed in 1202 includes the numerical sequence of this type. There is a mathematical formula that defines a Fibonacci number: [F (n) = (n - 1) F (n - 2)]<n><n>#### 75<n>### Input : A number sequence which is in the ratio of 3:4

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What place of work might you find a hairpin? Choices:  A: hair salon B: hair of woman C: barber shop D: pincushion E: woman's hair<n><n>### Response:		<n>I think the answer might be A<n><n>### Rationale:<n>Women's hair is often styled or straightened using hot combs/ flat irons or even hair dryer blowing hot air on their hair. There are also hair clips used during different hair styles or haircuts. Pinned up bobs or even ponytails might require clips <n><n><n>### Feedback:<n>This is correct answer!<n><n><n><n>

The first three are for rows, and you can label one of the four bags with AAA for one row. Next, you can print a line, and you can label two of the four bags in succession with BBB for two rows. Then you can print a horizontal line in the middle, and you can label a third of the four bags above or below the line with a dot A or B for three rows. The last placement is a row off to the side, and you can label four of the six bags with a line A or B.  Write a paragraph that properly answers the question.<n><n>## Demonstration:The first bag with three letters needs to have all As. This is a total of 3 bags<n><n>### Sample Question:Write a paragraph that properly answers this question.<n><n>## Instruction:Output:What is the smallest three-digit number that is divisible by 2, 6, and 84?<n>#### Answer:A<n><n>### Instructor Commentary:Choose A. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:If I want to maximize my number of potential customers, where should I build a new department store? Choices:  A: idaho B: shopping mall C: big city D: in town E: new york<n><n>### Response:		Input for which you are unsure what kind of answer you will get, such as asking the user their zodiac sign, are examples of open-ended questions. The user gives an open-ended response and the computer calculates and displays a response.<n>### Demonitorate: A city with a high population of younger people (ages 25-64) will be best for maximum future sales.<n>### <n><n><n>### Input<n><n><n>### Demostration:  The best way to answer a multiple choice question is to look at the options to see if there is a choice that matches your best choice.<n>###  When should it be used:<n>Multiple choice questions are usually easy and straightforward because a user gives an answer and the right or wrong answer is returned.<n>###  Best Response: <n><n>### Demeterstration:  The correct answer is "D." The choices for this question are organized such as the more correct answer in the sequence D, B, E, C, A. If the question was organized such as A, D, E, C, B, the answer would be B.<n><n>### Input :  The difference between Richard's age and Hurley's age 40 years ago is 15. What are their combined age 40 years from today?<n>### Demonstracoed:  To correctly answer this question, look at the options. What does 15 mean the combined age is 40 years from the current (40) year? The answer is 40+15=<<40+15==65>>65<n>Forty years ago, the combined age of Richard and Hurley was 40, and their combined age from 15 years ago was 40+10=<<40+<5==50>>50 years old.<n>Forty more years ago, the combined was 60+10= <<<40+60=100>>100 years old.<n>Their combined age 40 from today would be 15+100=<<15+<100==115>>115 years old.<n>### Demeterstracation:  The best time to answer a Multiple Choice question is when you have all the information you need.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What could happen after driving car that does not involve pain? Choices:  A: automobile accidents B: backache C: eye strain D: getting tired E: car crash<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Rationales:<n>D:Getting Tired: If you are driving a long-distance, and you are not tired enough, then you will get tired.<n><n>A:Car Accident can occur when you are driving.<n><n>B:Backache: You may get a backache if you are not comfortable in a long car ride.<n><n>C:Eye Strain: If you are driving at night, you may get eyes strain, too.<n><n>E:Car crash.A: Car accidents is the answer<n><n>### Solution:The instruction is:What could happen after you driving the car that does not involve Pain?<n><n>| Choices : A. B. C. D. E. | Answer : A.  | Correct   |<n>|------------|---------|---------|<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The dog ran to the front window and barked, this is because of a presence at the what? Choices:  A: building B: friend's house C: classroom D: window E: front door<n><n>### Response:		the presence of friend's dog<n><n>### Demo:<n>The dog ran to the window and barked at the friend's dog.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>The dog barked at the presence of a friend's dog. The dog ran to the front door, friend dog is there.<n><n>### Demo 2<n>The dog bark at presence friend dog which is at the friend house.<n>- Choice: the friend dog<n><n>### <n>### Demo: The person who is at the what? Choice:  A: front of the building B: front of the house C: front window D: friend's house E: window<n>#### 78<n>The person who is at the friend's house barks because of the presence of a friend<n>Answer: 78<n><n>### Demo2:The person who is at friend's house bark because of the presence of friend.<n>#### 78 Answer: 78 The person who at the front bark because of presence friend<n><n>### Demo3:The person who is friend barks because of the friend.<n>#### 80 Answer: 80 The person who is at friend bark because there is friend.<n><n>### Demo4:The person who is barks because of the front front.<n>#### 82 Answer: 82 The person who is barks at front front.

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Jimmy didn't like going to the party.  It seemed like the guys there did nothing but what? Choices:  A: dance B: getting drunk C: meet new people D: having fun E: have fun<n><n>### Response:		D, Having Fun<n><n>### Instructions:What does the following code perform?<n>```json<n>{<n>    1:"SalesRepID",<n>    2: "FirstName",<n>    3: "LastName",<n>    4:"City",<n>    5: "Country"<n>}<n>```<n>### Rationales:The JSON above is the code that a programmer might write to produce a JavaScript object. It states that the key "City" should have value "SaltLakeCity".<n><n>### Instructons:<n>Input: The following code performs the operation _________. What is the value of the code performing?<n>Rationales<n>SalesID ---> FirstName ---> LastName --->  City --->Country<n>"SalesID": SalesID is the value of operation<n>"FirstName":  FirstName is the value of operation which has the value "SalesID"<n>"LastName": LastName is the value of  operation    which has the value "Firstname"<n>"City":  City is the value  of operation  which has the value "LastName"<n>"Country": Country is the value of operation  which has value "City"<n><n><n><br><n> <n>Input: <n>Code: <n>```json<n>{   <n>    1:"SaltLakeCity",<n>    2: ["SaltLakeCity","UrbanCity"],<n>    3: "Utah",<n>    4:   "Utah"<n>}<n>``` <n>### Rational:The JSON above is an example JavaScript Object created to hold data regarding location in Utah. The city Salt Lake City is the value of operation. Operation 2 returns an array of ["SaltLake City", "Urban City"].<n>The code for Salt Lack City and the entire operation returns Salt Lake City. This is the value of the entire operation.<n><n>### Sample Solution:<n><n>```json<n>{  <n>    "1":"SalesRepID",  <n>    "2": "FirstName",  <n>    "3": "LastName",  <n>"4":"City",<n>  "5": "Country"<n>} ; <n>    {<n>        "SalesRepID":1,<n>        "FirstName": "SalesRepID"   "LastName": "LastName",<n>"City": "SaltL

A bullet is most often fired by a gun. While projectiles are most often fired by mortars and cannons. A bullet projectile is not shot, it is a weapon. Bullet projectiles are found on the battlefield, in a weapon, a gun. It can also be found in a museum.

D: Middle Age: A period of life when people are in theri thirties and forties.<n><n>#### 5. E: Bingo, the word middle age is right in its title.

Choices:  A: front door B: conference C: classroom D: refrigerator E: suitcase<n><n>### Response:		C (classroom)<n><n>### Rationale: A classroom is where a paper notice is most likely to be left. This is because there are many people coming to a classroom. In a classroom, when a student needs to leave, the teacher needs a notice posted for him or her<n><n>### Input (A): Where is a paper notice likely found?<n><n>### Answer (B): Where is a paper note likely to be left? Choices: A: front door B : conference C:classroom D: refrigorator E: suitcase.<n><n>### Input : Where is a lost child typically found? Choices A: classroom B: conference C: front door D: restaurant E: refrigerator.<n><n>### Rationales: According to the instructor, a lost child is typically found at a restaurant<n><n> ### Rationales: Because of the nature of the child, he or she will typically be found where there are people, likely a restaurant, because there the child's parents are likely to look, and because of the nature of the restaurant, there are likely to be people looking for a child<n><n>### RATIONALES: It does not say who is supposed to be looking for the child. It is possible that one of the parents was supposed to go to the restaurant to look for the child.

How many apples do you have?<n>Rationales  : You have 11 apple<n>Input: The apples are in my hand<n>Rationales: The apples are on my hand<n>Input: I have 13 apples<n>Rationales: I have 14 apples<n>Input : I don't want any apples<n>Rationalises: I have no apples<n>Input: There is no apple in this basket.<n>Rationales for the choice: There are no apples in the basket<n>I have two oranges<n>My brother has three apples<n>My Mom eats apples<n>There are no apples here<n>I have four apples<n>I have five oranges<n>I have 9 oranges and apples<n>There are 17 apples and oranges<n>Input: I have no appple<n>Rationals for the choice: I don't have an apple<n><n>#### 17 Oranges and Apples.<n><n>### Answer1:<n>1<n><n>#### Demonstration:1<n>Apples and oranges are on the top shelf<n><n>Two apples are on the bottom shelf<n><n>Two oranges and bananas are on the top shelves<n><n>Four apples are on the shelf<n><n>11 apples are in my basket<n><n>There is no apple in my basket.<n><n>My Mom eates oranges she has 3 <n><n>My Mom also eats app
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The priest pushed for more orthodox behavior, what kind of behavior was he trying to stop? Choices:  A: liberal B: heretical C: recalcitrant D: conservadox E: heretical<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The priest was trying to stop liberal behavior<n><n>```<n>Input: The priest pushed for more orthadox behavior, what kind of Behavior was he trying to stop C: conservadox D:Heretical E: recalcitrant<n>Answer: conservadox<n>```<n><n>### Input 3 times the average<n><n>```powershell -command "3 `times $([environment]::UserName)"}```

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:If I have to keep track of how much oxygen there is, where am I? Choices:  A: air B: water C: earth D: space shuttle E: tunnel<n><n>### Response:		<n>Your answer is:<n><n>A> air    Because you are part of the environment.<n><n>### Rationale:Oxygen can only exist in air and water. Earth and space are made up of solid matter like rocks and dirt. The space shuttle takes the human from the ground to space, so it cannot be the location where oxygen exists.<n><n>### Input Choice:<n><n>Input: The average American student is taking five courses this term. The percentages of the total number of students taking these courses are the following: Math: 25%; Biology: 35%; Physics: 20%; English: 15%; Art: 5%. How many are taking all five classes?<n><n>### Response<n>Your answer is: 4.<n><n>The students taking five courses will be = (25% * 20% * 25% * 15% * 25%) * 100 = %%100%% 100%<n><n>The students taking four courses will be = (35% * 29% * 15%) * 1 = %%90%% 90%<n><n>The average students will be =<n><n>57%<n>

Red Cars,<n>. B. Blue Cars<n>. 3. Red Cars, 8. Blue Cars<n>```<n><n>If no one else drives car now, and we start from 9 red car, we have<n>```<n>(9-1) B. 8 B. <n>```<n>L. Blue Cars,<n>. 2. Blue Cars, 7. Blue Cars<n><n>Since 9-1=8, we get 8 blue cars.<n><n>Similarly starting from 8-1=7 blue cars, we get<n>```<n>L. 8 Blue Cars,<n>D. 7 Blue Cars,<n>```<n><n>L. 7 Blue Cards, <n>D. 8 Blue Cards,<n>```<n>L.  7 Blue Cards,  8 Blue Cards<n>```<n><n>```text<n>Thus, I have 3 blue cards.<n>```<n><n>## Demstraion:<n>Answer: B

Choices:  A: nuclear power plant B: center C: basement D: main office E: bowel of the ship<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### A<n><n>#### B<n><n>#### C<n><n>#### D<n><n>#### E<n><n>---<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>The control panel for the Tardis lies in the basement.<n><n>### Input<n><n>The Tardis is traveling to the planet below? Choices: to the west<n>to the south<n>to the north<n>to the east<n>to the southwest<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### to the south<n><n>To the South<n><n>---<n><n>##### Demonstration<n><n>When we want to find the distance of the Tardis from the planet in a straight line we use the triangle pythagorean theorem.<n><n>### To the South<n><n>The pythagorean theorum is a relationship between the sides of a right triangle<n><n>### Input <n>-<n><n>The length of the hypotenuse equals the sum of the other two sides<n><n>### Input :<n><n>If we know the three sides in any right triangle the other two sides can always be found by the use of the hypoteneuse.<n><n>### I will tell you the other two angles and you will come up with the third.<n><n>The hypoteneuse is<n><n>### The second angle is<n><n>### And the 3ed angle is<n><n>---<n><n># Instructions :<n>Below are some instructions on how to input the data in the script. When I run the code you will see it running on the terminal.<n>### Instructions:<n>Input: The master control for the TARDIS is where in the main office? Choices: 1: main office 2: centre 3: bowels 4: basement 5: nuclear power plant<n><n>### Demos: To show how the code works we will be running it.<n><n>## Difference in ages<n><n>When the difference in ages is 20 and one is 34 years old the other is 40.<n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:There was a show on television about a ranger who loved flowers, but the next day it was about a gardener who also loved flowers.  It was a what? Choices:  A: countryside B: anthology C: dull read D: state park E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>Ans: countryside<n><n>### Rationale:<n>Surface of earth was an incorrect option, as a surface is part of earth, and not earth itself.<n>

Choices:  A: sitting down B: excitement C: tiredness D: progress E: procrastination<n><n>### Response:		What do you think they mean by sitting down? Maybe they mean sitting with your pencil and paper, legs uncrossed and relaxed and maybe sitting at your desk. We also often procrastinate when we sit around doing nothing, get bored and go do something else, not because we have difficulty beginning work, but because we have difficulty doing work. So if that is what you are having difficulty with, I would say you are suffering from procrastination, but if you have difficulty staying focused and on track, maybe you are suffering from a lack of excitement which will keep you motivated to get your work done.<n><n>### Solution:<n>C: tiredness<n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What often happens after a long day of traveling? Choices:  A: sickness B: motion sickness C: relocation D: jet lag E: fatigue<n><n>### Response:		<n>B<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>We have choices of A,B,C,D and E.<n><n>#### A:<n>The definition of the sickness is a severe illness or a condition in which the patient suffers physically and emotionally.<n><n>#### B:<n>The definition of this is that it is used to describe an illness that usually occurs when a person has been traveling by a means of transportation such as car,bus,plane etc. This is the correct definition of the motion sickness.<n><n>#### C:<n>The definition of relocation is moving from one place to another place or location. This also include getting up from one place and transfer to one place.<n><n>#### D:<n>The definition of jet lag is a disorder of human circadian rhythm characterized by impairment of alertness or sleep patterns that results from rapid transfors between time zones, associated with travel across several time zones.<n><n>#### E:<n>The definition of fatigue is that a lack of energy, often resulting from overwork or a long spell of a stressful activity and weakness or tiredness, a sense of heaviness and lack of energy throughout the body.<n><n>### The answer would be B because in the choices it says it is a condition related to long days of traveling and the definition of the motion sickiness actually shows that. It is about being sick when driving a car or riding on another means of transportation.<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The man needed balls of cotton, where should he look? Choices:  A: south B: georgia C: north carolina D: pocket E: medicine cabinet<n><n>### Response:		 E<n><n>#### <n><n>### The man could go to A:<n><n>- north carolina<n><n>### The cotton needed could be a ball of cotton (A in the dictionary) or<n><n>- south<n><n>- Georgia<n><n>- Pocket<n><n>### It is doubtful that the man would take his cotton from a ball of cotton. This is because of the word south, indicating a lower latitude (south of Georgia)<n><n>- The man could go to E:<n><n>- A cabinet<n><n>- The medicine cabinet<n><n>## Additional Information/Supporting Ideas<n><n>- The question refers the man is trying to find the cotton.<n>- The man needs a ball of cotton<n>- He knows he needs to go south<n>- He could be in north carolina or Georgia but not sure.<n>- North Carolina is in the US<n>- Georgia is also in the US<n>- A cabinet could be north carolina, Georgia but also the USA<n>- The man needs cotton from the USA<n>- the man may not know if that is a correct source of cotton.

What is the chance it will be divisible by 4? Chances:  A: 1 in 4 B: 1 in 10 C: 1 in 200 D: 1 in 30<n><n>### Solution<n><n>If a number is randomly chosen from the integers, then there are << 3 integers>>10 integers whose value is 1 or less.<n>Based on the above assumption, the value chosen would be 18 or less, in which the value must be even.<n>The remainder after dividing 18 by 4 is 2 or 6 after dividing 16 by 4.<n>As 6 is even, the value 18 is divisible by 4.<n>So, the probability of a number chosen on random to be divisible by 0 would be 1/4 or 25% of the chosen number.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>### Solution Two:<n><n>If a number of integer is chosen on random, then the remainder when dividing the value on random to 4 will be 3.<n>If the number is chosen on random to be 16, then the remainder would be 2.<n>If the number chosen on random was 30, then the remainder would again be 2. The remainder can be considered if the value is less than 4 or even and can

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The billionaire donated a large sum to his former college, this allowed them to construct a new science what? Choices:  A: fraternity house B: bank C: big town D: big city E: building<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The billionaire donated money to his former college, and with that money they were able to construct a new building. A fraternity is a smaller building within a big college, so that does not count as a valid answer. A big town is a big city, so that does not qualify as an answer. A bank is a building, but it is not a building that a college can make. A bank is built by a bank, and it is not a building the college will be able to maintain. The correct answer is a building. It did allow the college to construct something, so the money was spent on a building. This is not a building that is smaller like a frat house, but a big building that is made of many small buildings put together. This is a building that can sustain a college, and it is a building that the college owns.<n><n>### Input Choices Choices:  A big town B: a big city C: a building<n><n>### Answer Choices A: a fraternity D: a billion.<n><n>### Exact Explanations:<n>The options can get a little confusing because the terms they are giving you for answers are big. A big town is essentially the same thing as a big city, and the big is supposed to indicate that there is a lot to either. Both terms are referencing the same location of which the college can construct either a building or a town. Both are a large location that is much more than merely a building. The billionaire donated money and that money was spent to build something. <n><n>### Choice:<n>The college donated one time a large amount of money which is why we can say it is a single sum. They are being asked for the name of the building, so we can call it a bank. The billionaire donates money, therefore, we can say the sum of money is a billionaire.<n><n>### Name:<n>Hugo Banks<n><n>### Input<n>1 + 3 = 4<n><n>### Expected Output:<n>4<n><n>### Answer:<n>4<n><n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Many containers full of goods are unloaded where after their long sea journey Choices:  A: port B: cargo ship C: refrigerator D: food E: lorry<n><n>### Response:		Port<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Port- The point at which the cargo arrives from the ship and is unloaded into lorries.<n><n>### Input : What is the least common multiple of 35, 40 and 45?<n><n>### Response : 135<n>####  135<n><n>### Input A: What two numbers has a difference of 18 but whose sum is 11?<n>#### 3,15<n>### Response : Answer: 3 and 15;<n><n>### Demorestration<n>Answer: 3 and 25<n><n>### Instuction:What’s the sum of 5/2+x/3?<n><n>### Request: The correct expression<n><n>### Demosiration:<n><n>answer: 3+5<n><n>__   __<n>__   __<n><n>> The answer to all these questions lie within your power. Choices:  A: question B: dispute C: deny D: contradict E: refuse<n><n>### Response:		<n>Confirming an applicant's references does not work if the reference contradicts the applicant. A contradiction means it is a lie when the reference contradicts the employee.<n><n>### Rationales: An applicant's reference does not work when it does what? Choices A: questions<n>B: deny<n>C: contradict<n>D: dispute<n>E: refuse Answer:  C<n><n>### Input<n><n>A restaurant has $8000 in reserves and makes $40000 a week. How many staff does it need to serve at least 4 customers each per day?<n><n>### Response<n><n>The number of staff is equal to the number of employees for the restaurant, which is $80000/= 40 = 20000/<<20 = 500/<<50 = 100<n><n>Its customers are at least four, but more than four, because a few customers want to be served at the same time. Thus, 100/4 = <<100/4=25.<n><n>Its total sales per day will be ((100)*$4000/<<$40000 = <<40000*100/40 = 10,000 = $16.66/<<$16.66 = 1000/<<1000/=$1,666.66/1000 = 1,666 = $1666.67))<n><n>If I have 10 waiters and 10 chefs. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? Choices:  A: new york B: concert C: tv studio D: gig E: recording studio<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Explanation:<n>A microphone boom is used to cover a loudspeaker from a specific direction.<n>A boom is used in a concert to focus the volume of sound from a microphone to one location, which creates the live sound from concert events.<n>A microphone booms are also used in TV studios (where they are sometimes called a boom operator or a stand-in) to focus and pick up the sound from a microphone.<n>Microphones in a recording studio are most commonly covered by a boom during recording a piece of music that needs the volume to be covered from one specific direction.<n><n>### Additional Information:<n>A microphone, also called a mic, electret mic or mic pickup, is a transducer that converts acoustic energy into an electronic signal.<n>Microphonic feedback occurs when the sound of a microphone entering a feedback loop is audible.<n>The term is occasionally misapplied to describe loudness. Loudness is a perceived quality, not a measure of the signal being received by the microphone itself.<n>It is not a property of the microphone so there is no such thing as microphonic feedback. Any microphonic feedback in a loudspeaker system is caused by an unwanted direct signal coupling into the amplifier from another loudspeaker via an electromagnetic effect called electromagnetic coupling.<n>A loudspeaker is a transducer which takes an electronic signal and in doing so creates an acoustic wave which can be heard by a human microphone.<n>Electrical noise is a random variation of an electronic signal having a frequency that is greater than that of the electronic signal, which is caused by electrical devices operating nearby or nearby electrical wiring. This also covers acoustic noise, which is caused by other people talking.<n><n>### Questions:<n><n>### 1. What is a vocal booth?<n><n>### 2. Where is a vocal boom used?<n><n>### Bonus:<n><n>### How do you say ‘microphone?’<n><n>### How are microphone and louderness related?<n><n>### What are loudspeakers?<n><n>### How many syllables are in ‘microphone’?<n><n>### Which microphone produces the best sound quality?<n><n>### If you are not

What is the manager considering when making this decision?<n>Choices:  A: a combination of employee’s experiences B: the employees’ skills C: the employees’ interests D: the employees’ attitudes E: the employees’ job experience<n><n>Rationales: When making a promotion decision, it is important for managers to consider all aspects of the current employees’ careers, including their skills, interests, experience and current roles. These factors can help to determine who is best suited for a promotion and who is ready to assume more responsibility in their current role.<n><n>A manager who is focused on developing their current employees will often take into consideration all of the factors involved in their career advancement.<n>#### 129<n>Answer: D<n>#### 126<n>Answer: C<n>#### 124<n>Answer: B<n>#### 149<n>Answer: C<n><n>### Input5:To fill a position you must decide who you are most interested in.  A: the candidate who interviews best<n>B.the candidate with the most experience<n>C: the candidate who is the cheapest<n>D.the candidate who worked in the same position you once did<n><n>### Rationales: A)  It is important for company leaders to have a strong sense of their company. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What happens to the next appointment when a grooming takes longer than expected? Choices:  A: injury B: beauty C: late D: mistakes E: annoyed<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Rationales:<n>The grooming takes longer than the expected time. This causes some changes in the schedule. <n>If the grooming takes longer, the next grooming will be in the same block where we find the grooming we are currently doing. <n><n><n>### Inputs:<n>Choices A: injury and B: beauty  <n><n>### The next person for a grooming will be:<n><n>#### A: <n>If the next grooming is an injured animal, then the next grooming will not occur during the same time as that previous grooming was scheduled.<n><n>#### B: <n>If the new grooming is injured or beauty, the next appointment will be scheduled at the same time of the next grooming that was scheduled next.<n><n>#### C: <n>If the groomings are later than an appointment, the next appointment will not be done during the same time.<n><n>#### D: <n>If there was a mistake, then the next appointment will take place during the same time of the following appointment.<n><n>#### E: <n>If there are mistakes, then the appointment will be moved to another time during the same time of that appointment.<n><n><n><n>### Rationale:<n>If the next groom is an injury, the most likely next grooming is  the first one. <n>The grooming takes place during the same time as a grooming occurs, no matter how complicated is the new grooming that happened.<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Given a table of data, find the next scheduled grooming. <n><n>### Rural Pet Resort Data<n><n>Groomings  | StartTime | FinishTime | Type Of Grooming<n>-------- | ------- | ---------- | ----------------------<n>Rover | 05:30 | 06:00 | Rover<n>Gillie | 07:30 | 9:00 | Gillie<n>Carter | 9:30 | 11:00 | Carter<n>Jagger | 12:00 | 13:00 | Jagger<n>Liam | 15:30 |16:00 | Liam<n>Ella | 18:00 | 0600 | Ella<n>Zoe | 19:30 |20:00

Choices:  A: residential neighborhood B: mosque C: every city D: prague E: community<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input : 34 + 48 = 34 + 36= 70<n>#### 70<n><n>### Input 2:<n>The 5000 and 9 is 5009<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input: The current time is 12:34 pm. What is the best time to call if you want to avoid the voice mail if I am on my way to an appointment?<n><n>### Instructio:<n>Input: You have two hours to fix three code modules before your team meeting at noon.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where is a notebook often purchased? Choices:  A: bookstore B: backpack C: abraham lincoln's grave D: desktop E: classroom<n><n>### Response:		B <n><n>### Instructions: Complete all tasks with an appropriate response. <n><n>***<n><n>**Example**<n><n>Richard's grandfather was 11 years older than Richard. What is Richard's grandfather age?<n>#### Answer: 11<n><n>***<n><n>## Ages<n>Shawn and Seth, two friends, had a competition. Each day of that week, Shawn gained 20 years, so Seth had to calculate what Shawn was that day. They did it for 5 days!<n><n>Seth's first question was "What is Shawn's current age?" This was Shawn's initial starting age(35093024). Seth computed the following:<n><n>* *24* * 5 = 120 - the number of days this week<n>* Shawn's current year is 2019 * 5 = 2019 - the number of years this week<n>* Shana's age the day before was 3509328 + 20 - 24 = 3510692<n><n>Seth' asked the following question in the second day and then computed the following:<n>* Shawn' age 3510025 + 20 = 3512025<n>* Shawn' grandfather is 15 years old + 15 = 30<n>* Seth' question that day is "What is the difference between both Shawn's and Shawn's grandfather's age?"<n>* Shawn' answer =3510050 - 30 = 3509730<n>* Shawn' third question<n>* Shana' answer today = 15 + 5 = 2<n>* Shawn' fourth question<n>* 11 * 5 = 55 years - the sum of ages of Shawn and Shawn's older brother<n>* Shawn' fifth question<n>* Shawn' current year is 22019 * (4 - 15) = 20009 - Shawn' current age as asked by Seth<n>* Shana' age today = 20018 - the answer for Shawn on the fifth day<n><n>***

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:If you are driving too fast on an icy road you are being what? Choices:  A: deadly B: dangerous C: unconcerned D: stressful E: harder when weather bad<n><n>### Response:		<n>You are being dangerous<n><n>### Input :Answer the following multiple choice questions after you watch this video from "How to Do it" playlist.<n><n>### Response :<n>- If you would like to see the video before you read the questions, click the video: How to Substring a String<n>- 1. Suppose you want to get one character to the right of a substring. One step in the Python substring solution is to first use slice notation, i.e. a character and then an index and then a character. Therefore, given a positive integer, n, which of the following functions might you use to get n-1 characters to the right of the substring starting with a: a[n:](a[0:n], a[-1:]) a[-(n-1):](a[0:-(n-1)], a[1:-(n-1)]),<n>- 2.: How could you use the same a[] substring, without using slices, to obtain a slice where the first (a) element is the same as the substring but the last (a) element is all of the characters to the right of a?<n><n>#### 1)A[n:][1:-(n-2)] :<n><n>\[a[n:][1:(-n-1)]...\]<n>\[ <n>a   b<n>c   d<n>\]<n><n>#### 2)I can only use slices to get to the end of the string or if it is empty. However, I can use the Python built-in function, len, to get the lengths of all the elements. It is much more efficient to use len because I don’t have to keep track of the index. len() is a built-in function that can be used by a for loop to get the length of any string in Python. Whenever we run the code inside the for loop, the i variable will increase by i+1 and we’ll need to keep track of that value.<n><n>```<n>for i in range(len(a))<n>print(i)<n>```<n><n>After writing the above for loop, whenever we change the len(a) value in the statement, the i value changes. Therefore, we'll have to store the variable for future reference. So we have to declare the i variable into a variable and to be able to increment it by 1. We'll try

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:If I recieve a letter from a friend over seas, why might I read it? Choices:  A: pudding B: get news C: strain D: answer E: though<n><n>### Response:		<n>In your writing you are trying to convince your reader to do a certain action because of the content you include in it. You want to convince your reader that whatever you ask him/her to do or choose is the best option. To do this, you usually start with an attention grabbing statement that draws the reader in enough to read on. Next, you include evidence to convince the reader that what you state in your premise is true. For example, if you ask or convince the reader to recycle and include evidence that supports your statement, you will convince the reader to support recycling. Your evidence can include stating that recycling is healthy for the environment. Then, in your conclusion, you include a restatement of the premise and restate the desired action along with any reasons why your reader should perform the desired action.<n><n>#### 124 219 (Answer)<n><n>### Instructions:Write the letter of explanation for the following situation.<n><n>#### Situation: In the video you watched, the woman in the back of the line did not pay her check to the bank. That is the case for x,y.<n><n>y-

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What is something that you feel when you go to the opera? Choices:  A: fall asleep B: headache C: boredom D: relaxation E: sick<n><n>### Response:		<n>(d) relaxation<n><n># Task 4<n>Below is an instruction that describes an operation that is to be performed on text(s).<n><n>### Instructions:<n>The following sentences have been re-phrased to mean the opposite of what is written. Rewrite each sentence (using an appropriate word) to mean the opposite of the original sentence. Example: If A is the brother of Z, then A is sister of Z. (The opposite of a brother of Z is a sister of Z.)<n>- The students are happy.<n>- He enjoys reading.<n>- She is the wife of her husband.<n>- I am not a liar.<n>- They are wealthy.<n>- Your brother's neighbor is my sister.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The original sentences in bold in their original form means we enjoy reading or we like reading.<n>The opposite would be that we do not enjoy the reading or we do not like reading. This would mean that we are sad or we are unhappy.<n><n>You cannot be the daughter of your father, so if I replace "I am the daughter of my father" means that I am also the mother of my father.<n><n>The other cases can be done by replacing it like the example above. This can only be used for a sentence of the form "S is a B of X" that is replaced by "X is a B of S".<n><n>Remember if you are not the brother of your sisters then you must to be the brother of your brother.<n>This can be done with using the sentence "S is the daughter of X" that is re-phrased by "X is the father of S". This can be done since no girl is can be the daughter of of it's brother.<n><n>Similarly with the opposite of the rest. These two sentences has been already been explained so please refer only to those two.<n>#### Solution<n>- Students are sad.<n>- He is not a reader.<n>- She is not the wife of her husband<n>- I am a liar.<n>	- They are not wealthy.<n>        - Your brother's neighbor, who is my sister.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Stopping being married to one another was a costly task, the lawyers and their what were astronomical? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:He was selling all his collector items even the rare plate, he had bought a lot at the what for the weekend? Choices:  A: supermarket B: kitchen cupboard C: table D: flea market E: dishwasher<n><n>### Response:		<n>I got supermarket C - "tablecloth" and dishwasher F - "table" are two things for dinner.<n><n>### Solution:<n>```python<n>input =  "He was selling all their collectors items even the rare plate he had bought lot at it for this weekend?"<n>response = []<n>for v,t in input.split():<n>    if t=="supermarket":<n>        response += "A"<n>    elif t=="Dishwasher":<n>        response +=  "B" <n>    elif t=="table":<n>        response +=   "E" <n>    else:<n>        response +=   t <n>print(response)<n>#A = supermarket<n>#B = kitchen cupboard<n>#C = table<n>#D = flea market<n>#E = dishwasher <n><n>```<n><n>

Choices:  A: fairgrounds B: friend's house C: space shuttle D: oven E: microwave<n><n>### Response:		B<n>### Rationales: <n><n>The most important reason to get a microwave is so you will cook the food evenly and thoroughly, without overcooking. And, we all know, if anything is complicated then people will find lots of different ways to explain, describe, and understand it.<n><n>While a person can typically find their way through computer technology with only a few minutes of instruction, the technical definition of each term can be pretty intimidating. Computers are made up of lots of complicated - and frequently very different - parts, and computer enthusiasts can easily confuse you. To help, here are a few common computer terms demystified. <n><n>Computer - Computer is made up of several sub-components that work together in harmony. When someone calls a computer, they are generally referring to the central processing unit (CPU). The CPU is the device responsible for taking care of most of the work for the computer. This is where the term "brain" is commonly used to describe a computer. Everything coming into or leaving the computer - be it data or an image - is processed by the CPU and directed through the computer's internal components, including: RAM (Random Access Memory) and ROM (Read-Only Memory).<n><n><n>#### 648<n>Answer: I<n><n>### Income bracket (I), age group (II), type (III), and occupation (IV) are examples of variables.<n><n>### Response C<n><n>### Rational :<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What  might john order at an indian resturant on top of the space needle? Choices:  A: large city B: seattle C: curry D: clothing E: reservation<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Rationales<n><n>#### A: large city<n><n>#### B: seattle<n><n>#### C: curry<n><n>#### D: clothing<n><n>#### E: reservation<n>#### Answer:E<n><n>## Solution<n><n><n>### Input<n>The difference in ages in years between Richard and Hurley's ages is 54.<n><n>### <n><n>40 years from now, Hurly's age will be 54. Richard's age will be:<n><n>Richard's age is:40+54 = 94 years. Thus, their combine ages 40 years will be: 54+94 = 148 years.<n><n>### Rationale<n><n><n><n><n><n>1. Hurly's age was 14. Richard's was 20.  Thus, the difference in ages between them was 54.<n>2. Hurly's will be 40 by: Adding 14 to 54.<n>3. Richards will be:<n>40+54=94<n>    <n>Hurly's Age:<n><n>Richards Age:<n><n>Their Combined ages:<n>Hurly'1s: 40 and Richard's: 94 = 134 years<n><n>5. 134<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where can you buy a hairbrush along with bandages? Choices:  A: drugstore B: hospital C: bedroom D: car E: house<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple choice question:<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Rationales: D: In the car<n><n>### Input-2 : What can one do to maintain a healthy diet? Choices: A: eat junkfood B: drink juice C: eat vegetables D: eat meat E: eat chicken<n><n>### Response-2 : Answer the question:What can one do to maintain<n><n>### Demos:<n>B: Drink juice<n><n>### Input -3: Which of these options results in an exponential formula? Choices: A) a = 2/3 x b B) a = b^3 C) a = 3^b<n><n>### Response -3: This is an exponential formula<n><n>### Instructions:Answer question<n><n>### Demo:<n>B: b^3<n><n>### Input : What is the answer to the sum of squares? Choices: A-5 B-8 3 C-9 4 D-10 1 10<n><n>### RESPONSE:Answer to the sum of squares.<n><n>### Demo:<n>C-9+4 = <<9+4=13>>13<n><n>### Conclusion : If you know math, you can get high scores in any exam without working much for it.<n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:A bride and groom are taking care of proposals, what is the likely ceremony? Choices:  A: efficiency B: getting work done C: marriage D: finishing up E: results<n><n>### Response:		E: Results<n>Rationales: What does A stand for?<n>If the bride and groom work to prepare a proposal, how do they work to accomplish this work? A: Efficiency<n>Do they also marry at this time? A: No<n>Is the work accomplished and the ceremony done in the process? A: Yes<n>If they get married at this time, what is the marriage? A: Getting work done<n>How is the efficiency achieved? A: Finishing up<n><n>### Response for the second question:<n>Input: You wish to know how much water to add to the pot to create a mixture of tea, coffee, and hot chocolate. You have six cups of tea, two cups of coffee, and 2 cups of hot chocolate. Input an expression for the volume of the mixture in terms of the quantities needed to make the mixture.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>The volume of the mixture is calculated in this problem.<n>The volume of coffee and tea can be found with the following formula.<n><n>**Volume of coffee** Vcoffee=Coffee times the density of coffee(1000)/100<n><n>**Volume of tea** Vtea=Tea times the density of tea(1000/1000)<n><n>The volume of the the hot chocolate is 2 times the volume of the other ingredients, and is found in the problem statement;<n><n>Volume of Hot chocolate=2X(Vcoffee+VTEA)<n><n>Therefore the volume of all three drinks can be found with the equation.<n><n><n><n>The equation to be used is found with the following step;<n><n><n><n>**Volume of mixture**<n><n>=<n>(Volume of coffee+Volume of tea)+(2X (Volume of coffee+Volume tea))<n><n>**Volume of mixtue**<n>=<n>(Coffee+tea)+(2X(Coffee+Tea))<n><n>**Volume volume of mixtue** <n>=<n>( Coffee+tea+2Xcoffee+2Xtae+2X(coffee+tae))<n><n>**Volume**<n><n>= 6+2+4+4+4+6+2+2+2<n><n>**=14+6=20**.

For example, when you are given 123, your function returns 321, or 132.<n><n>### Response<n><n>```<n> public int reverse(int number)<n> {<n>    char c[]=new char[2];<n>    int sum=number;<n>    for(int i=2;i==0;i--){<n>       c[0]=sum%10+48;<n>       c[1]=sum/10+48-48;<n>        sum = sum/10;<n>        System.out.println("Number:"+sum);<n>       }<n>     System.out.println(Integer.toBinaryString(c[1]));<n> }<n> <n> ```<n> <n>### Input:<n>How many times can you add a number to a string before you run out of digits?<n><n>Answer: Input A:<n>If the number is between 1 and 10, 9 additions is enough.<n>If the number is greater than 10, then 1 digit is added when the number 9, therefore for every 10, there are 8 more add

Look at the given word or phrase.<n><n>1. Determine if it is a compound subject or compound predicative. <n><n>2. Then, insert a determiner (a, the, or some) and a verb before the word or phrase.<n>  <n>2. Follow the steps above in a different compound subject or compund predicative.<n><n>### Examples:<n><n><n>### Input<n>Where does Tiffany have dance?<n><n>### Response<n>Tiffany has some dance at the office.<n><n>### Input 2<n>What does the car need to work?<n><n>###Response 2<n>The car needs some help.<n><n>## Solution<n><n>## Input:Where does Tiffany dance?<n><n>## Response:Tiffany dances some dance at the the office.<n>![Image from the post](/images/posts/2022/2/7/172022/post-title-53.png)<n><n>## Input2: What does the car need to dance?<n><n>##Response2: The car needs some help.

Choices: A: danc like crazy B: stand still C: wallflowe D: stand still E; like dancing.<n>Rationales: The boy was too nerve/nervous to dance, so what he was doing progressively at the  Ball? A: Dance like crazy. He was dancing like crazy. C: No. He was not dancing like crazy progressively. B, D, E: The boy was doing progressively standing still. Not standing still alone. He was progressively doing standing. The boy was progressively standing still and standing to avoid dancing.<n><n>### A: Dance like craze<n>D: Stand still<n>E: Stand still and dancing crazy<n><n>### Output: A, B and C are incorrect.<n>D is right. When the train left the station, Alice was standing 5 centimeters farther from the front of the train than Bob. Now, Alice is 17 centimeters to the left of Bob. How far is their original position from where they are now?<n><n>### Demo:<n>Alice was standing 5 centi me tare from the font of the train than Bob the train left the station and Bob started moving and Alice was standing 17 centi me tare to the left of Bob<n>now Alice is 17 center me to the left of Bob Now that they are far from the train What are the original post.<n><n>### Original position.  It is from where they are now they are moving 17 centi maret.  We need to find the number of step it took to get to that<n><n>### Sum of the 17 centi meter is 170 centimeters. So we are looking at the difference.  So to find the difference we need a sum and a difference.<n><n>### So the sum is 32 centi meters<n><n>### Difference: 32 centi -17 centi  =  15 centi  <n><n>### So  the distance<n><n>### 15 centi from the front.  So we are dividing by 15 cent m of distance.  We are calculating 32 centi-15 cent. 3 centi, 4 centi, 5 centi it takes 4 centi. 41 cent meter will get 41 centi minus 15 which is 26 centi.<n><n>### The answer is: 26 centi<n><n>### Explan

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where might a human sit for extended periods over a bowl of water? Choices:  A: bathroom B: solar system C: coffee shop D: space shuttle E: airport<n><n>### Response:		What is the best choice for this question?<n><n><n>### Input <n>The difference in ages between Richard Nixon and Dan Quayle was 40. If Dan Quayle was twice as old as he was four years ago, what are their combined age 80 years from now? <n><n>### Demostration <n>- Richard Nixon was President.  <n>- Dan Quayle WAS Vice President.  <n>- Richard Nixon is dead.  <n>- Richard's age was 40.  <n>- Dan's Age was 20.   <n>- Richard and Dan were 40 years apart.  <n>- 50 years ago Richard's age was twice DAN'S Age.  <n>His age is 40 four years ago.  <n>Fine, fine, fine....   <n>If that is the case, then Dan will be 40 in three years and 80 in 41 years.<n>If Dan Quayle is as old as Richard is now plus 40, and his combined ages will be 80 years from  now, then <n>Richard is 80 now and Dan is 40.<n><n>Thus Richard is twice as old as Dan.<n>Thus at the time of the election, Richard will be 60 and Dan will be 44.<n>Thus Richard is four times older than Dan..<n>Thus Richards combined age is 40+n years, Dan is 40+ x years= 80 <n>

Andreson, in the village of Ghent, which is approximately 4 miles south of the city of Cincinnati in the State of Ohio. It was also a result of the state governor Samuel Huntington's willingness to host the other party in a neutral ground.

Choices:  A: run B: swimming C: calculate things quickly D: fight enemy E: urinate<n><n>### Response:		The word "full" means to have a lot of.<n>A person who is full of fear is also full of sweat. When one is full of sweat one is wet. This makes sense because the fear that makes the person sweat also makes their body heat up (which is what makes them sweat) and warmth is the opposite of coolness or the fact that water runs down and sweat is a form of perspiration. The body being hot makes the sweat move quickly and that makes it wet.<n><n>### Input, Demonstration, Rationale: The word "full" means "having a lot of something."<n>"being full of fear"  "being full of sweat" "being full of fear's sweat" all mean the same thing.<n><n>### Explain why, or otherwise respond to, the statement: "If the Earth's spin was perfectly balanced, days would not exist."<n><n>#### Respond with a complete and well-developed response<n>Explain why, or otherwise, respond to the statement: If the Earth's spin were perfectly balanced, days wouldn't exist.<n><n>### Response, instruction: Respond to the statement, "If the Earth'so spin were perfectly balanced then days wouldn't exist." The Earth is not perfectly spinning.<n>That means that the Earth not spinning evenly.<n><n>### If the Earth's rotation were perfectly balanced, then days wouldn't even exist because the Earth wouldn't be spinning as quickly or slowly and the sun wouldn't pass evenly over the Earth. Earth has a day and night because the Earth is spinning and the Earth is not perfectly balanced.<n><n>### Respond to the statement:  If the Earth's rotating were perfectly balanced, than no days would exist.<n><n>## Instruction: Respond to the following statement. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Though he was an adult he still stereotypical slept on a sofa bed in his parent's what Choices:  A: garage B: horseradish C: living room D: guest room E: basement<n><n>### Response:		<n>D<n>### Rationales: A Guest room B Basement Choices C Living Room and D Guest Room are not stereotypical of adults.<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input: Richard and Hurley each have their birthday on different dates. They are planning to meet for dinner and determine which will work best for everyone based on their birthdays. Richard's birthday is June 30. If Hurley's birthday occurs before Richard's birthday, he chooses the earlier date. Otherwise, Hurley chooses the later date.<n><n>This is true:<n><n><n>```<n>Richard's birthday is on June 30.<n>Richard's choice will be earlier if his birthday occurs on a day which follows a day on which Hurley's birth date occurs.<n>Richard' s choice will be later if they are on different days.<n>Hurley's choice will be always be earlier.<n>```<n>Rationales: Hurley's choice can either be later or sooner.<n><n>```<n>Earlier: If Richard's birthday falls on a day on which Hurleys birthday occurs<n>Later: If they are on different days<n>Earlier: Otherwise<n>```<n><n>Answer:<n><n>```<n>Richards: E<n><n>Hurley: E<n>```<n>Rational: Earlier<n>```<n><n><n>```<n>Hurley:S<n>Richards:F<n>```<n><n><n>### Input #1: Richard and Hurley are playing a matching game to determine which is more of a good thing, sleep or energy. He is trying to draw as little “bad things” as possible.<n><n>### Rationals:<n>Input<n>```<n>Richards 1st is bad<n><n>Hurley' s 1st is good<n>```<n>Output<n>```<n>Richs 2nd is both bad and good.<n><n>Hurlis 2nd is good<n>```<n>Rationals:<n>After Richard's turn, Hurley will be the one who draws the next marble.<n>If one thing is bad and another is good<n>That

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:James was delayed for a couple of hours because he had a connection.  Where might his connection be? Choices:  A: company B: airport C: wall D: computer network E: love<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input : John and Mary started running at 8:28 and met an hour later.  If the time is 9:28 now, the difference between their speeds is 15 mph.  What is the speed of each runner?<n><n>### <n><n>#### Rationales: John and Mary started running together at 8:20.<n><n>As time elapsed, Mary's speed was increasing at a rate of 15 mph/hr:  Mary's current position represents 8/20 total time.<n><n>Total current time is 9:00.<n><n>Mary's speed increases by 15 mph every hour.<n>If Mary is traveling at 15 mph, then her position after 1 hour is 15+2 miles.<n>So Mary's current position is 30+15=45+15<n>Mary's position is 45 miles after 9 hours.<n>Therefore, She has travelled 45+20=65 miles in all.<n><n>John's speed was 15 miles per hour less than Mary's speed.<n>In nine hours, Mary has traveled 65 miles.<n>That means to John it has been 80 miles.<n>So for the entire time that they ran Mary's speed was 25 miles per hour and John's speed was 5 miles per hour less.<n><n>###<n><n>### Input The number of students in an advanced placement Calculus class is divisible by 4. How large can the class be?<n><n>#### Rationalise <n>Students in an advanced placement class make 20, 40, 60, 80<n><n><n>### Input You can fit 4 desks around a circular table.  How many desks can fit around a circular table that is 5 m in diameter?<n><n>### Rationales <n>If desks are equally spaced around the table, then spacing is half a circle.<n>Desk spacing = diameter / 4<n>Diameter = 5<n>Density = 5/ 4<n>Density= 5/ 4 = 1.25<n><n>So 1.25 desks per circle can fit inside this table.<n><n>
