If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The crowd wasn't that big.  It can better be described as what? Choices:  A: field B: alone C: small group D: solitude E: solitary<n><n>### Response:		<n>A) field<n><n>Forty years<n>from now I will be 34 years<n>and my friends will be 56 years<n>I am younger, but I will be 21 % more old because they will be more old<n><n><n>### Input<n><n>Forty four years ago<n>I was 12 years old<n>my father<n>was 33 years old<n>and my grandmother 70 years old.<n><n>### Rationales<n><n>If I had been in the same situation<n>then the same happened<n>40 years ago = 40*40 = 1600 years now<n><n>then the same has happened that my father was 73 years old<n>and I was 53 years old.<n>1600 - 13 =1587 that happened to me<n><n>### Answer<n><n>53 years<n><n>Answer: 53 years<n><n>#### A<n>### Input<n>Courtney<n>cannot find a good solution to the problem<n>of how to measure the amount.She is going to tell the <n>drug dealer that <n>she cannot find a solution to her problem and<n>she is going to tell her that he is making mistakes with the dealer<n><n>### Output<n>Courtney cannot find a more intelligent way to measure her<n>and she is going to stop making mistakes<n><n>Courtney cannot stop making mistakes<n>the amount<n><n>### Input <n>the amount of drugs<n>is too much and that the drugs are overwhelming.<n><n>### Output: The amount if drugs that you are giving us is too much.<n><n>The amount of drugs that you are asking for is too small<n><n>### Difference between inputs and outputs<n><n>### Input and output examples<n><n>### Inputs vs. outputs<n>1. **The amount of drugs is too much.** is shorter than<n>**The amount of drugs**. Both are used as the beginning of<n>an utterance. While the former is shorter (by the removal of 'ing'),<n>which the latter has no effect on the length of the<n>utterance. The latter, however, is harder to pronounce, since<n>one would have to pronounce two words starting from the same<n>stem.<n><n>2. **The amount of drinks are not enough** means that the drink
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:If clothes have developed a smell and can't be washed what should you do with them? Choices:  A: hang in closet B: sniff C: get dirty D: become soiled E: air out<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer is B. Hang them in the closet.<n><n>### Rationales: Hanging clothes in the closet will air out smells in the clothes without having to use detergent. If clothes have developed a smells and can’t be washed, the best alternative is to air them in the closet! If there are multiple articles of clothing, you can hang them together but, you can't hang all clothing in the closet if there is not enough room inside.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What might the inability to learn cause? Choices:  A: intelligence B: education C: effectiveness D: distress E: a stupid<n><n>### Response:		If someone does not learn, he will have less intelligence, education, or effectiveness. To be distressed, you do not even have to learn.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The inability to learn can cause a lot of different outcomes. You can lose intelligence, education, or even effectiveness. You can also not be able to learn how to do something properly, which means the person will be distressed.<n><n>The inability to be able to learn will not cause the "A stupid" outcome because distress can only come along if you can not learn anything properly, you do not need to be able to learn anything in that case for distress to occur.<n><n>### Input:(1) A single computer can be used as a personal computer, a workstation computer, a computer that is used to connect printers. Which best lists the ways that a computer might be used?<n><n>### Response:(1) A single personal computer, a single workstation computer, or a single computer that can connect printers is the best option. There are many ways that computers can be used. However, a single computer can only fit into one of these categories. A single computer can not be used for multiple purposes. A personal computer has one user. Thus, can not be used as a workstation. A single workstation computer can also only be used as a computer that connects printers.<n>### Input: Is the given equation correct? 51 = 5893% 5<n><n>### Response:-<n>The given equation is correct. To find how many percent, 5893/5 = 1178 ==41.7557142857143%, so we can see that this is the correct equation. If you divide 51 by 5893 (41.75) and you will get 99.948%, which is more than 10 % so this is not a correct equation.

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Rationales: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>#### 128<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Danny hated helping people.  It always brought what? Choices:  A: satisfaction B: good feelings C: complications D: feel good about yourself E: stress<n><n>### Response:		<n>Rich helped his mother, his sister, his wife. A simple task, but Rich wasn't satisfied. "Rich, why don't you ask for help when needed," said Rich's wife. "I need a little space," said Rich. How would you ask for help? Rich is asking for a little space, but is that not what you want when helping someone? I think so, but Rich didn't. A little space didn't provide enough comfort for Rich. So, Rich helped to solve his problem without complaint. If Rich wanted help sometimes he wouldn't ask for a little space. A simple task may create a few complications, but Rich was satisfied.<n><n>### Source:https://github.com/KushalMandhera/Ch10Questions
